story:
Help us raise money to fund an education scholarship in Nigeria!

African Borderlands Community Development - PDN builds on the financial assistance provided by Northeastern undergraduates enrolled in Politics of Developing Nations (PDN) to two neighboring villages separated by the Nigeria-Niger international boundary in West Africa. Three major premises undergird ABCD-PDN:

  1. That students learn best about third world development when they are directly connected to, and involved with, specific communities overseas;
  2. That populations in low-income countries are better served by people-to-people initiatives than by “foreign aid” funneled through governments;
  3. That peace between African nations can be fostered by simultaneously aiding neighboring communities in their shared borderlands.

$650 will allow PDN to help two children buy books and uniforms for school in the town of Yardaje, Nigeria. 

About the communities we support:
Yardaje (Nigeria) and Yekuwa (Niger) are two rural Muslim Hausa villages separated by the international boundary superimposed by British and French colonial régimes at the turn of the twentieth century. Today, most villagers live on less than $2.00 a day. Thus far, using their own funds matched by seed money from the Department of Political Science, Northeastern students have provided: bulls and carts; goats for widows; emergency medical transport assistance; high school scholarship funds; school supplies; new latrines; and a women’s microcredit project. Visit the Projects page to learn more.

Thank you for your support! To learn more about the ABCD Project, visit www.northeastern.edu/abcd/

The Lowdown

After many years of doing local freelance photography, I finally recognized (at age 24!) that I needed to pursue a formal education. I applied with my portfolio to the Delaware College of Art and Design and I got accepted! I've been going to school for a few months and my semester is almost over. I've learned so much in the small amount of time I've been attending DCAD and I've never felt so artistically challenged.

Only one problem; I'm low on funds. I love the school and I don't want to have to leave.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm trying to raise $5k to keep attending college. I'm not eligible for a loan, I make minimum wage, and my scholarships only covered the initial cost of supplies and the first semester of classes. I NEED SOME HELP!
  • With your donations, I will send you some of my art. I have photography prints, note cards, and drawings that I would love for you to have as a token of my gratitude.
  • Regardless of whether or not I reach my financial goal, I will use all donated funds toward my next semester of school, every little bit counts!

The Impact

Any amount you can donate would mean so much to me. I want to share my love of art with people everywhere and going to school will open numerous doors to what I want to do with my future.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, spread the word!

  • Please share the link to this campaign! Tell your friends, tell your enemies, tell your mom, tell anyone that might be able to contribute!
In addition

here's a link to some of my freelance photography

story:
*UPDATE*

Get additional In the Dog House sticker sets for just $5 each (exclusively on indiegogo)! 


What is In the Dog House™?

In the Dog House is an entertaining (and educational) sticker set for children ages 5 and up - the first EVER rhyming words sticker set!

Unlike any other sticker set on the market today, In the Dog House is aligned to common core standards and is designed to help children learn rhyming words, build vocabulary, and develop fine motor skills.


                                 


How Does it Work?

In the Dog House is a hands-on learning activity that includes colorful scenes and PVC-free reusable dog stickers. Children will delight in moving the dogs in and out of the dog house with the matching rhyming word. 


Quick Facts

  • Colorful scenes
  • PVC-free reusable dog stickers (eco-friendly!)
  • Aligned to common core standards
  • Helps children learn rhyming words, build vocabulary, and develop fine motor skills
  • Comes in a convenient, handled carrying tote, perfect for travel




Green Product

In the Dog House comes with reusable dog stickers made from PVC-free material. The eco-friendly stickers are durable and safe for your child and the environment!


Perks - It Pays to be an Early Bird!

  • Get an early bird DISCOUNT (when you choose 2 or more)
  • Get FREE shipping and handling (U.S. only - add $10 for shipping outside the U.S.)


$1 - A great BIG (virtual) BEAR HUG from all of us at Kids Smart Books and Toys

$10 - ONE In the Dog House Rhyming Words Sticker Set 

$18 - TWO In the Dog House Rhyming Words Sticker Sets

$25 - THREE In the Dog House Rhyming Words Sticker Sets 

$32 - FOUR in the Dog House Rhyming Words Sticker Sets 


About Us

At Kids Smart Books and Toys, our mission is to make learning (and teaching!) fun. Our children’s products are unique, fun, educational, convenient, affordable, and eco- friendly (made from eco-friendly materials, recyclable, or designed to promote environmental awareness and conservation). We strive to create innovative educational products that children will enjoy and want to use again and again!


                                         


WARNING: CHOKING HAZARD - Small Parts

Not For Children Under 3 Years.

story:
Short Summary

Two classes away from finishing my MA in Special Education, San Francisco State University cut off my tuition grant.   I filed an appeal, and won the appeal, but was told that a new policy overrided my appeal.   I even wrote the Director of Financial aid, but to no avail.   I could take out a loan, but because I'm at the aggregate maximum I'd need a co-signer.   So I decided to explore other possibilities and a close friend of mine suggested that I put my situation up on this site.

Ironically, at the same time they told me my tuition would no longer be covered the school awarded me a $3,000 grant for conference travel - contingent on me enrolling in classes.   I'm scheduled to present at the Psychology of Mathematics Education-North American conference in Chicago in November and at the California Mathematics Council-Asilomar in December.   It's forbidden to use the $3,000 for tuition, and I can't "unlock" the money unless i can come up with the money for tuition.    So you can think of it almost like a matching grant, I guess :-)

My research in Special Education focuses on two simple questions: - What is it about mathematics that makes it so challenging for so many people and how can we teach it so that everyone can understand?   At the same time, I think we need to move away from endless practicing of procedures and focus on mathematical thinking.   I find inspiration from the ideas of disability studies and queer studies, and consider those paradigms central to my work.   My "creative project" for my degree will focus on the creation of a training workshop for mathematics teachers that encourages them to think creatively and innovatively about mathematics disability and mathematical possibility.

Where would the money go?
 
Part-time fees for a graduate student at SF State are $2442 per semester.  So, for two semesters that equals $4884, and then counting the 4 percent surcharge:  x - 0.04x = 4884, so x = $5087.   Even if I don't reach that goal, funds will be applied to tuition and I will come up with other ways to raise the rest of the money - applying for scholarships, working part-time, and anything else I can come up with.
 
Perks

The primary perk of funding this work is making my conference available to all using free/libre/open (FLO) licenses.   All of my conference papers are available on my website:  http://www.jamessheldon.com - under the Creative Commons CC-BY-SA license - you are free to share, copy, and remix the work as long as you keep the same terms.


That said, at risk of sounding like a dreaded PBS pledge drive, I'm happy to offer a few individual perks, which are listed in the perks section.   I'm not adding any extra money to what I'm asking for to cover perks, though, so feel free to opt out of the perk and have your entire donation go towards the tuition.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some other ways you could help:
* I could use help in researching scholarships or fellowships and someone to read those applications over and give feedback.
* I could use leads on part-time or full-time work
* I could use a co-signer ("endorser") for a graduate plus loan
* I could use some mentorship from someone who's done professional development work for mathematics teachers
* Or even just someone to read over my conference proposals and give feedback on my work
 
Or even just pass this campaign on to your friends.   (Indiegogo and their corporate affiliates would like me to remind you to use the "Share" tools on this page, for what it's worth.)

story:
Romans 10:14-15 - How then can they call on the One they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the One of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can they preach unless they are sent? As it is written, "How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news?"

"So, you have three possibilities in world missions. You can be a goer, a sender, or disobedient. The Bible does not assume that everyone goes. But it does assume that the ones who do not go care about goers and support goers and pray for goers and hold the rope of the goers." - John Piper

Our good friend Tyler Hall has decided to spend five weeks of his summer on CRU Summer Project in East Asia. Tyler was inspired by his time on his mission trip to Haiti on Spring Break and felt the Lord calling him to East Asia. This decision does not come without a price as Tyler's trip will cost upwards of $5,600. No small task having recently raised support for Haiti. As Tyler's friends, it is our hope to be the ones who send him. As it says above in bolded letters, "How can they preach unless they are sent?" It is our desire to be those senders.

Please consider making a donation, no matter how big or small, knowing that this decision will make a difference in eternity.

Chicks dig the long ball. Give generously.

story:
My name is Sionah Rielly, I am currently fundraising for Projects Abroad so they can enable me to visit Kenya later this year so that I can help children with disabilities and the less fortunate to enroll in education and improve lives. I will be taking along with me my 5 year old daughter who will integrate within the community and school where although being only 5 she will be a huge asset to the cause, of which I am very proud of her. We are planning to assist on a project in Kenya, organised by the safe hands of ‘Projects Abroad’. Registered charity number:1109932

Whilst my income is low, my ambitions are high and my wish to provide an enriching experience for my daughter and help her to help others is one of my main motivators.

This would be an enormous boost towards our goal to spend six weeks pouring our energies into furthering a project that is establishing worthwhile services where they are sorely needed.  It will also broaden the horizons of one remarkable little girl and her myself who can see beyond the confines of our hitherto rather narrow existence.

It was 3 years ago my baby sister was born with the condition Down syndrome, it was then I realized what my life had been lacking. I gave up my job as a full time Beautician and went back to study whilst doing various work within the community voluntary and different charitable organizations unpaid mainly including: Ups and Downs charity, Mind mental health drop in centre where I ran my own cookery class, and Pen green children’s centre.

I have already raised funds through various events, I held a bake sale at my local Children’s Centre then on the 12th April I held a family fun day which I prepared for in 7 weeks and was a huge success. I have attached an article printed in the local newspaper on my project and fundraising of which I was interviewed for on the 14th March 2014. Also on the 25th March 2014 I recorded a live on air radio interview at 12pm on Corby Radio. It is our dream to offer ourselves to help those less fortunate than ourselves.

It is my hope that when I have finished my studies that I will move me and my daughter to a developing country to teach English as a second language.

If you are in a position to help in any way possible, I would be so grateful.

story:
About Us

A group of students at the University of Arizona traveled to different parts of the world to create unforgettable experiences and memories. What we found was extreme poverty. After seeing people suffer from living under the international poverty line, we each thought to ourselves:

“How can I make a difference in the world?  How can a few students make an impact?”

                 

A little over a year ago, we found a way to help.  Starting Loans Across Borders, the University of Arizona’s only micro finance club, is our way to make a difference. We have introduced the club to the Tucson community by hosting an Oxfam Hunger Banquet and selling crafted goods at Tucson Meet Yourself made by Ghanaian entrepreneurs.  During the Spring 2013 semester, we came into contact with Christiane Milev, a founder and the current director of Village Exchange International/Ghana, a nonprofit organization we are working with to give micro loans to local Ghanaian entrepreneurs.



  Tucson Meet Yourself

      Hunger Banquet

     Christiane Milev

Why Micro Finance is Important and How it Works

Have you ever heard the saying: “Give a man a fish, and you feed him for a day; show him how to catch fish, and you feed him for a lifetime”?

Micro finance is the financial embodiment of this principal. We don’t just give people money; we loan money to people to start and grow their own businesses so that they have the ability to move themselves and their communities out of poverty. When they repay their loan, the money, including a small amount of interest, is re-invested in another entrepreneur.

We make this possible by partnering with organizations like Village Exchange International/Ghana (VEG). VEG is in Ghana working directly with these local entrepreneurs and has programs to inform villagers of these opportunities and aid them through the process.  VEG will be having weekly meetings with the loan recipients to help keep them on track towards repaying their loans. Loans Across Borders club members and contributors to this campaign will receive updates on these weekly meetings and the progress that is being made.

                               

How You can Help

Twelve women in Ghana need loans to help them grow their businesses. We need your help to raise $5,000 to give these twelve women the money they need and the power to become self-sufficient. Below are three of the women we are hoping to provide loans for:


Rejoice Akoeda is a 41-year old mother of 3 children. Rejoice is a seamstress and has been working in her shop for 8years. She is planning to expand her project by selling clothes in the future. She is currently requesting a loan from VEG to buy new cloths so as to earn enough to support her household.


Madam Mina Ansah is a mother of four children who lost the husband about six years ago. She is currently engaged in the production of palm Kernel both within her locality and beyond. Mina who is 38 years dreams of expanding her current business through the VEG micro finance program. 

 

Patience Adraku has been making and selling Palm Oil for the past four years in order to support her household. She has an enterprising spirit and with the intention to generate income she decided to start her own oil business. She started to make the Palm Oil in her house and sell it to her friends, neighbors and others she knew. The business has grown so much since then; she now sells to schools, soap manufactures and event organizers. Patience is asking for this loan in order to buy machinery to produce enough and buy raw materials (palm fruits, firewood, and tanks) to create a positive growth in her business.

 

A small donation is enough to change the financial coarse of an entire family.

Even if you can’t donate, make a difference in the lives of these women by spreading the word. Tweet about our campaign and share our story on Facebook.


Why donate to us? 

We are a group of aspiring business professionals about to graduate from college. It is important to us that we get involved abroad not only to help those in extreme poverty, but also to participate in the realization that we are citizens of the world and that we can have an impact outside of our college community. We will take this lesson of humility and giving to others with us as we graduate and move to other stages in our lives.


Every bit of money we raise will go directly towards providing micro loans and we can’t wait to share our progress with you!
story_txt:
About Us A group of students at the University of Arizona traveled to different parts of the world to create unforgettable experiences and memories. What we found was extreme poverty. After seeing people suffer from living under the international poverty line, we each thought to ourselves: “How can I make a difference in the world?  How can a few students make an impact?”                    A little over a year ago, we found a way to help.  Starting Loans Across Borders, the University of Arizona’s only micro finance club, is our way to make a difference. We have introduced the club to the Tucson community by hosting an Oxfam Hunger Banquet and selling crafted goods at Tucson Meet Yourself made by Ghanaian entrepreneurs.  During the Spring 2013 semester, we came into contact with Christiane Milev, a founder and the current director of Village Exchange International/Ghana, a nonprofit organization we are working with to give micro loans to local Ghanaian entrepreneurs. 


  Tucson Meet Yourself


      Hunger Banquet


     Christiane Milev
 Why Micro Finance is Important and How it Works Have you ever heard the saying: “Give a man a fish, and you feed him for a day; show him how to catch fish, and you feed him for a lifetime”? Micro finance is the financial embodiment of this principal. We don’t just give people money; we loan money to people to start and grow their own businesses so that they have the ability to move themselves and their communities out of poverty. When they repay their loan, the money, including a small amount of interest, is re-invested in another entrepreneur. We make this possible by partnering with organizations like Village Exchange International/Ghana (VEG). VEG is in Ghana working directly with these local entrepreneurs and has programs to inform villagers of these opportunities and aid them through the process.  VEG will be having weekly meetings with the loan recipients to help keep them on track towards repaying their loans. Loans Across Borders club members and contributors to this campaign will receive updates on these weekly meetings and the progress that is being made.                                 How You can Help Twelve women in Ghana need loans to help them grow their businesses. We need your help to raise $5,000 to give these twelve women the money they need and the power to become self-sufficient. Below are three of the women we are hoping to provide loans for:Rejoice Akoeda is a 41-year old mother of 3 children. Rejoice is a seamstress and has been working in her shop for 8years. She is planning to expand her project by selling clothes in the future. She is currently requesting a loan from VEG to buy new cloths so as to earn enough to support her household.Madam Mina Ansah is a mother of four children who lost the husband about six years ago. She is currently engaged in the production of palm Kernel both within her locality and beyond. Mina who is 38 years dreams of expanding her current business through the VEG micro finance program.      Patience Adraku has been making and selling Palm Oil for the past four years in order to support her household. She has an enterprising spirit and with the intention to generate income she decided to start her own oil business. She started to make the Palm Oil in her house and sell it to her friends, neighbors and others she knew. The business has grown so much since then; she now sells to schools, soap manufactures and event organizers. Patience is asking for this loan in order to buy machinery to produce enough and buy raw materials (palm fruits, firewood, and tanks) to create a positive growth in her business.       A small donation is enough to change the financial coarse of an entire family.  Even if you can’t donate, make a difference in the lives of these women by spreading the word. Tweet about our campaign and share our story on Facebook.     Why donate to us? We are a group of aspiring business professionals about to graduate from college. It is important to us that we get involved abroad not only to help those in extreme poverty, but also to participate in the realization that we are citizens of the world and that we can have an impact outside of our college community. We will take this lesson of humility and giving to others with us as we graduate and move to other stages in our lives.Every bit of money we raise will go directly towards providing micro loans and we can’t wait to share our progress with you!

story:
Where Would You Be Without School?

Do you ever stop and think about what your life would be like if you had never gone to school? Would you have learned how to read or how to use a computer? Would you have the same career that you have now?

When you live in a society where going to school is a basic right, it’s hard to imagine that there are children in the world who have never seen the inside of a classroom. Instead, these children spend their time working to support their families, either because they are too poor, don’t have access to a school, or their parents don’t understand the power of education.

This is the life of countless children and families in Nepal.

With Your Help...

We can break the cycle of illiteracy and poverty by building a school and bringing the power of education within reach of Nepal’s most impoverished communities. By building a school, we will improve the lives of children and families not only today, but for generations and generations to come.

Our goal with this campaign is to send six qualified volunteers from the US to Nepal to take the first steps toward building a school in a community where one does not currently exist. We need your help because before we can begin laying bricks, there is much work to be done to ensure that we achieve the maximum benefit for the children and families we serve.

Who We Are

Ganga Ghar is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of impoverished children and families in Nepal through education. We started in 2009 by sending five children to school. Today, in 2012, we work with six different schools in Nepal to educate over one hundred children through the generous support of Ganga Ghar’s sponsors, donors, and volunteers. We have twenty team members between the US and Nepal who spend their time and talents toward achieving Ganga Ghar’s mission. We are dedicated to the long-term transformation of the lives of the families we work with in Nepal.

In 2011, Chase Community Giving recognized us as one of the nation’s best local charity organizations. We strive every day to pursue our mission with the highest standards of integrity, compassion, and gratitude for the opportunity to fulfill our vision of a brighter future for the poorest children and families in Nepal.

Why Build A School?

Our work with six different schools across Nepal helps educate over one hundred children, but there are still regions that lack schools. In those areas, children and families are locked in cycles of poverty, and Ganga Ghar has been powerless to help.

With your help, Ganga Ghar can build a school to reach these children and families and offer them affordable education. This indiegogo project is focused on the first steps of this journey: We will travel to Nepal to conduct research, survey communities, finalize the location for the school, and work with the community to emphasize the importance of education and what a school can mean for the children and families in the region. 

Meet Our Team

Our team of six volunteers brings a variety of skills to the table, but they all have one thing in common - dedication to helping the children and families in Nepal through education.

Ojash Shrestha - Ojash is a native of Nepal and the founder of Ganga Ghar. He lives in the US in Milwaukee, WI with his wife and newborn daughter, Gia. His successful career as an IT consultant could not have been possible without a great education, and he wants to share that opportunity with the most impoverished children and families of his home country.

Binod Parajuli - Binod has been with Ganga Ghar from the beginning, and he lends his support from Atlanta, GA with his wife and newborn son, Eshan. He was born and raised in Nepal and came to the US for education and a career. With gratitude for the opportunities he has been blessed with, Binod is committed to helping break the cycle of poverty in Nepal.

Rahul Shakya - Rahul is an active volunteer on the Ganga Ghar team, and he is also a native citizen of Nepal. His passion for Nepal, knowledge of the country, and photography skills will help us navigate through Nepal and document our progress along the way.

Todd Blagrave - Todd originally became involved with Ganga Ghar as a sponsor, but he realized that there was so much more he could do to help the organization grow. As a resident of Milwaukee, WI with deep experience working at a Big Four accounting firm,Todd brings financial expertise to the team that focuses on efficient and transparent allocation of organizational funds.

Jodi Elias - Jodi brings her experience working in international development, as well as being a Ganga Ghar sponsor, to the table. In her eyes, education is the best way to help create positive change in the world. Her experience in poverty and disaster relief in international projects brings great strength to the team. Jodi's passion for storytelling has helped shape how Ganga Ghar communicates its mission and vision. 

Mike Luedke - Mike’s experience in marketing, research, and teaching English as a second language, in addition to supporting Ganga Ghar from its inception as a sponsor and a friend of the founder, has led to a deep commitment to the vision and desire to help make a lasting impact toward a brighter future for Nepal’s most impoverished children and families.

Trip Schedule

  • Oct 29th to Nov 3rd
    • Visit sponsored children and families in the capital city, Kathmandu, and the rural communities of Dhading, Jhapa and Tanau in order to do volunteer work and witness the impact of the existing sponsorship programs. 
  • Nov 4th to Nov 11th
    • In Chitwan to visit the school site and create blueprints.  We will create video documentaries as we visit families and the local community to gather data surrounding literacy, population, and household incomes.
  • Nov 11th to Nov 16th
    • In Chitwan and Kathmandu to file official government paperwork, meet with contractors and the local GG team to plan next steps. 

Funds Distribution

  • Airfare and Visa fees - 35%
    • We’ll use part of the funds to help us cover the cost of the long journey to Nepal. We’ll use some of our own funds to cover these substantial costs, as well.
  • In-country Expenses - 20%
    • Some of the funds will help us cover the costs of...
      • Safe transportation to six schools that we currently work with across Nepal where we will volunteer with the children and their communities.
      • Meals and lodging when we are unable to stay with family or friends of Ganga Ghar.
  • Research & Planning - 35%
    • We’ll use a portion of the funds to hire the best contractors we can find to help with planning the architecture and layout of the school.
    • The funds will also help us conduct our research and documentation in the communities we visit, including surveys, film and photography, and the eventual presentation of our findings.
  • Rice Distribution - 10%
    • We will donate 10% of the funds we raise in the form of rice to the poor communities we visit throughout the trip. We hope to distribute at least 1000 lbs during the trip.  

Thank You

Thank you to all of the donors, sponsors, volunteers, and supporters all over the world who have helped us reach this exciting new step in fulfilling our mission of improving the lives of impoverished children and families in Nepal.

By contributing to this campaign and sharing it with your family, friends, and social networks, you are helping future generations of Nepal reach their full potential through education.

In-country Expenses - 20%

Safe transportation to six schools that we currently work with across Nepal where we will volunteer with the children and their communities.

story:
Welcome to the MyQUEST funding project, as you’ll notice in the above clip, we are not movie masterminds, we are teachers. We have partnered with renowned Australian Software Developers, Studio Emotion (our techno wizards) so we may build this mutli-platform learning system.

As you know, 21st century technology has contributed to massive changes in communication, education and societal expectations. Cyber bullying threatens children in their homes and incidents of anxiety, teen pregnancy and teen suicide grow at an alarming rate. Our kids need help. They need our support. They need to learn how to cope with a maelstrom of emotion, thought  and information that assaults their senses every day. Our children need to learn how to interact within the world so they may recognise and evaluate what they see, hear and feel. This help starts in the home, extends into the classroom and moves beyond to online platforms.  If young adults don’t have the skills to ‘fit in’ the 21st century, if young learners don’t have 21st century literacy tools, if our kids don’t have learning flexibility, they simply will not survive.

Therefore, we want to develop MyQUEST, a fully interactive learning platform for smartphones and tablets. We want to use the latest and greatest in learning technology to help young adults become confident, courageous, creative and compassionate, lifelong learners. MyQuest  is based on the Is This MyStory Learning process. Its innovative design utilises the features of narrative to link gaming technology, animation, interactive pages, film, music, books, blogging, storytelling, social media, global connectivity and much more. MyQuest uses the technology young adults love, to help them develop a focused, flexible approach to learning. With MyQuest, teenagers embark upon a journey toward a critically, emotionally and creatively literate future.

We all know, today’s teens don’t go anywhere without their phones. With MyQuest, they will be carrying 21st century learning tools wherever they go. Perhaps you’d like to think about this – would you prefer your teenager played with slightly upset birds - becoming angrier by the second, or would you like them to recognise their thoughts and manage their emotions while interacting, studying or simply playing with ideas.

With your contributions, we can make this happen. We aim to generate enough funding to breathe life into cutting edge technology that will help teenagers connect and learn in constructive ways. You can help us develop an elite platform which incorporates intricate gaming, detailed illustrations, creative animations and complex interactivity.

As a system, MyQUEST is a 4 Phased learning platform (4 apps) and, even though we have already developed and written the content, the project will cost approximately $150,000 to complete. Nevertheless, we have set an initial target of $25,000. This will help us build Phase 1. All funds will be put toward the cost of developing the software. Of course, we would rather create all 4 phases at once and have set stretch goals in the hope of reaching the total amount. These stretch goals will also allow contributors to access Phases 2-4 and open opportunities for Launch Parties in Melbourne, Brisbane/Gold Coast and hopefully, overseas.

We’d love to come to your city, visit your schools, talk to your teachers , meet you and throw a big bash launch party, especially New York, London, Vancouver or even Honolulu (more information can be found below under Launch Parties).

 

Is This MyStory is an Australian business founded on principals of metacognition and built on the teaching experience of Nicole Feledy, a passionate, innovative English teacher / author who loves stories and genuinely cares about her students. Nicole and the MyStory team have recognised deficiencies within educational systems worldwide.  They see a growing number of students left behind, unable to develop the key skills they require to survive in a technological era.  Nicole and her team want to help. They want to provide tangible strategies that will enable students throughout the world to develop key skills in critical, creative and emotional literacy. These are the 21st century skills our children need to thrive in a time of rapid change.  Imagine 21st century learners with 21st century tools, feeling confident, courageous, creative and compassionate because they are lifelong learners in control of their own learning.  Whether it be in the classroom or simply the action of living life as a 21st century teenager, our children must have the implements of successful learners. Meeting students where they are and providing access to these strategies is the number one goal of Is This MyStory and the MyQUEST Learning project.

 

So how can you get involved?

It’s quite simple! There are two generous ways you can contribute and we hope you will do both:

The first way is extremely simple; just share the word with people you know. Email your family, friends and local schools. Share the link on your blog, FaceBook, Twitter, LinkedIn or any social media site. Share the message with everyone you can think of. The more people who know about MyQUEST, the greater the chance of achieving our goals. For starters you may like to share the link on FaceBook and Twitter now by clicking the icons below our introduction video. Go on, do it now, you know you want to.

The second way to get involved is to pre-purchase MyQUEST by claiming one of the perks on the right hand side of this page. After clicking, you will be asked to confirm your perk and fill in your delivery details (it’s even easier if you’re on FaceBook). You can then choose to contribute using Visa, Amex, Mastercard or Discover (IndieGogo has excellent security to ensure your details are safe).

 

You will notice down the right hand side of this page we have designed different contribution levels, or 'perks', to benefit yourself, students and schools around the world - so everyone gets a little something. For example, the $99 Party Time Perk will get you MyQUEST Phase 1, the Is This MyStory eBook, the MyStudy Muse Program, a Mindfulness Session, tickets to the a Launch Party PLUS we will donate 10 MyQuest Phase 1’s to a needy school on your behalf. How good is that? Imagine how much students will appreciate your generosity!

NOTE: If you prefer, we are happy to transfer your gifts to family, friends or students you may know.

Here are your choices:

We appreciate we will have many international contributors and will be happy to accept donations in other currencies including $US, GBP, EU and $CAN. Oh, heck! We will accept any currency. :))

The Is This MyStory eBook is the foundation upon which MyQUEST is built. It is not essential, but an obvious advantage to read the book while venturing along the MyQUEST journey. The eBook will be downloadable upon completion of this campaign.

We estimate completion of MyQUEST by March 2013.

The MyStudy Muse Guided Learning Formula is a 4 week online guided learning exercise which a student completes on a daily basis. Students develop practical strategies to improve their study skills whilst cultivating mental focus and concentration. MyStudy Muse is a 10 step process and compliments the Is This MyStory Learning process.

This is the Launch Pack. We believe it will initially be most popular for those living outside Sydney, Australia. In relation to donating the apps to needy schools, the number of people that choose this perk and the number of students per school will determine the number of schools we can donate to. Keep an eye out for the stretch goals, because once met, we may end up launching in a city near you. If and when this happens you will have the option to upgrade to the Party Time Perk to attend.

Launch Parties are planned to be held upon completion of MyQUEST, so around March 2013. See the Launch Party Section below for more information. At least you’ll have plenty of time to arrange a babysitter!

We predict this perk will be the favourite among Sydney siders.

Your teenagers get the 21st century tools they need, you do your bit for the community, donating MyQUEST to local schools and you get a fun night out.

Unbeatable!

Well that’s not entirely true because we have more contribution levels below which offer even more goodies.

This is as unique as it comes – we are printing a limited edition paperback version of Is This MyStory, with a twist. The current print version features the first names of students Nicole has taught over the years printed on the cover. However the new limited edition will have your full name (or a name of your choice) along with the other 49 contributors embedded, on the cover design. There will only ever be 50 of these made and they will all be signed and personalised for you by Nicole (author). This would make a fantastic birthday or graduation gift for that special teenager. PLUS you receive the Launch Pack and a great night out.

This perk is designed for schools, whether you are a school or would simply like to donate on behalf of a school of your choice. You or the school will still get the Launch Pack and Party tickets and can choose from having Nicole present her spectacular Is This MyStory Interactive Seminar at the school or a 1yr unlimited MyQUEST license for the school. This license will be developed during 2013 and will offer schools greater learning facilities, interactivity and additional features within the MyQUEST platform.

Now you’re really showing some heart! So many schools around Australia rely on government funding to obtain the learning tools students need and quite often funding is insufficient. It would be a dream for us if we could donate at least 10 devices to each of these needy schools. At this perk level we will donate a tablet device with MyQUEST in your name to a local needy school. Plus you still get all the usual extra goodies, WOW!

Another great perk for the school of your choice. The MyQUEST License is better than an individual scholarship as it will benefit every student in the school, not just one. You’d be helping an entire community here.

Similar to the You’re Too Kind Perk plus an added tablet device for yourself (or student of your choice) plus some additional MyQUEST Phases donated in your name. PLUS the best part is becoming a recognised producer in the credits of MyQUEST learning platform (All 4 Phases) – what a golden opportunity.

For the carers that really want to make a difference. This perk is jam packed full of stuff for everyone including extra tablet devices for schools, VIP tickets, domestic flights*, accommodation, MyQUEST school license and much more. And best of all, you will become a recognised executive producer in the MyQUEST learning platform credits (All 4 Phases).

Outstanding, give yourself a pat on the back when you select this one. C’mon do it for the kids!

Please note the flights and accommodation are to be used for the Launch Party and maybe used for your city of choice if different Launch Party Stretch Goals are met.

Never been to OZ, always wanted to come down under? Well here is your chance. Pack your bags, buy some sunscreen and bring a hat. This is the package of a lifetime and we can confirm you’re single handedly changing the world. And best of all you will become a recognised executive producer in the MyQUEST learning platform credits (All 4 Phases).

You’re so exceptional, we may even vote you in as Prime Minister of Australia!

*Domestic and International Flights are direct only, no connections or airport transfers.

If you’re considering funding the entire 4 phase project you definitely are mighty, we’ll cook you Aussie BBQ’s, take you swimming with the sharks, take you hunting for crocodiles, show you the Great Barrier Reef and carry you up Uluru (Ayres Rock). We’ll even buy you a beer!

The question is…is it time to elect the President of Australia?

Simply contact us and we’ll personally collect you in our MyStory ‘jet’.

 

Remember, to share with the FaceBook and Twitter buttons at the top of the page.

 

So what happens next?

The campaign will finish on the Sunday the 16th December 2012.

Now, if we don’t reach our initial goal of $25,000 (unlikely since we have your support), MyQUEST will still be developed, however we may be slightly delayed. We will still honour all perks. Although, we don’t want to focus on not hitting the target as we have complete faith in you sharing our project with everyone you know (and even those you don’t). Did you remember to share our project on FaceBook?

The Is This MyStory eBook and MyStudy Muse will be delivered within 5-10 working days of the campaign ending.

If we only just reach our initial target, MyQUEST Phase 1 will be downloadable after the initial Launch Party, estimated to be in March 2013. If and when stretch goals are met, resective phases will also be available at this time.

The Mindfulness Session will be delivered in early 2013 (Date TBA).

The Limited Edition Is This MyStory books may either be collected at the Launch Party or delivered immediately thereafter.

Launch Party Tickets will be emailed upon confirmation of dates and venues. See below.

Tablet Devices will be delivered once the 4 phases are complete. If all stretch goals are met the 4 phases will be ready for the Launch Parties and available for collection or delivery.

The MyQUEST school licenses we be completed later in 2013 and also rely on the completion of all phases.

Flights and accommodation are only to be used to attend the Launch Parties and will be arranged upon confirmation of Launch Party dates and venues. Every effort will be made to accommodate the travel plans of the contributors.

 

The initial Launch Party will be in Sydney, Australia upon completing the development of phase 1 of MyQUEST - estimated to be in March 2013. We have set stretch goals (see below) which, once reached, will enable us to hold numerous launch parties in different cities. Therefore, we will confirm dates and venues upon completion of the campaign. Obviously, we would like to hold each event on consecutive dates, wherever possible.

 

The initial goal is only set at $25,000 to complete Phase 1, but we really want to complete the full 4 Phased Learning System, which will cost approximately $150,000. Therefore, we have set stretch goals to ensure this will happen and offer you, the contributor greater incentives.

Please note the initial target is to compliment the funding already contributed by Is This MyStory.

Initial Target

Everyone who purchases The Door Opener or greater will receive MyQuest Phase 1 plus all the individual perk inclusions. At this stage, if you live outside Sydney you’ll have to make the trek to be part of the MyQUEST Launch Party.

Stretch Goal 1

As soon as we reach stretch goal 1 everyone who purchases or has purchased The Door Opener or greater will automatically be upgraded to receive MyQuest Phase 2 also.

We will now be holding Launch Parties in Sydney and Melbourne. To ensure we hold a launch party in your city we recommend you contribute as early as possible and get the MyQUEST word out there within your community. This way we’re more likely to reach these stretch goals. For example, if you grab the Ready to Launch Perk, once we’re getting close to this goal you can upgrade to the Party Time Perk to confirm your launch party tickets in Melbourne. It would also be a great help if once you’re Ready to Launch you email us with your intentions to attend a Launch Party in your city, regardless of which city – Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, London, NY or anywhere.

Simply send your email to storyadmin@isthismystory.com and tell us your city of choice. We can then provide updates so you will know which cities are favoured and when and where the parties are likely to be held.

Stretch Goal 2

As soon as we hit stretch goal 2 everyone who purchases or has purchased The Door Opener Perk or greater will automatically be upgraded to receive MyQuest Phase 3.

We will now be holding Launch Parties in Sydney, Melbourne and either Brisbane or Gold Coast. To ensure we hold a launch party in your city we recommend you contribute as early as possible and get the MyQUEST word out there within your community. This way we’re more likely to reach these stretch goals.  For example, if you grab the Ready to Launch Perk, once we’re getting close to this goal you can upgrade to the Party Time Perk to confirm launch party tickets in your city. It would also be a great help if once you’re Ready to Launch you email us with your intentions to attend a Launch Party in your city, regardless of which city – Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, London, NY or anywhere.

Simply send your email to storyadmin@isthismystory.com and tell us your city of choice. We can then provide update so you will know which cities are favoured and when and where the parties are likely to be held.

Stretch Goal 3

As soon as we hit stretch goal 3 everyone who purchases or has purchased The Door Opener Perk or greater will automatically be upgraded to receive MyQuest Phase 4.

Now we’re thinking BIG, we want an international launch party. We will hold a launch party in the first international city to collectively purchase perks with 100 launch party tickets, so make sure you let us know which city you’re from. To ensure we hold a launch party in your city we recommend you contribute as early as possible and share the MyQUEST word with your community, this way we’re more likely to reach these stretch goals. For example, if you grab the Ready to Launch Perk, once we’re getting close to this goal you can upgrade to the Party Time Perk to confirm your launch party tickets in your city. It would also be a great help if once you’re Ready to Launch you email us with your intentions to attend a Launch Party in your city, regardless of which city – Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, London, NY or anywhere. We could be coming to see you, do you mind if we stay at your place?

Simply send your email to storyadmin@isthismystory.com and tell us your city of choice. We can then provide update so you will know which cities are favoured and when and where the parties are likely to be held.

Stretch Goal 4

Every time we reach another $20,000 on top of our total and have over 100 launch party tickets sold collectively within a city anywhere in the world, we will arrange another launch party. Plus a one year MyQUEST License will be donated to a local school within that community.

To ensure we hold a launch party in your city we recommend you contribute as early as possible and share the MyQUEST word with your community, this way we’re more likely to reach these stretch goals.  For example, if you grab the Ready to Launch Perk, once we’re getting close to this goal you can upgrade to the Party Time Perk to confirm launch party tickets in your city. It would also be a great help if once you’re Ready to Launch you email us with your intentions to attend a Launch Party in your city, regardless of which city –London, NY, Rome, Cairo or anywhere.

Simply send your email to storyadmin@isthismystory.com and tell us your city of choice. We can then provide update so you will know which cities are favoured and when and where the parties are likely to be held.

 

Please note while we have included the shipping of the tablets and limited edition books Is This MyStory takes no responsibilities for any taxes, customs or duty and will be liable to the contributor.

No perks or part there of may be altered, changed or redeemed for cash.

Apps will be available and downloadable dependant on stretch goalss met and completion of iOS and Android versions.

MyStory will determine the number of apps to be donated to needy schools in relation to the number of perks purchased. The obvious goal is to donate to as many schools as possible. Furthermore, it will also rely on the downloadable versions required by individual schools, ie iOS or Android.

The Is This MyStory management hold the rights to not use a persons name, or part there of, on the website dedication pages, limited edition book covers or within the MyQUEST credits if deemed to be offensive.

Domestic and International Flights are direct only, no connections or airport transfers and are to be used to attend Launch Parties in corresponding cities.

Accommodation is to be used to attend Launch Parties in corresponding cites.
story_txt:
Welcome to the MyQUEST funding project, as you’ll notice in the above clip, we are not movie masterminds, we are teachers. We have partnered with renowned Australian Software Developers, Studio Emotion (our techno wizards) so we may build this mutli-platform learning system.
As you know, 21st century technology has contributed to massive changes in communication, education and societal expectations. Cyber bullying threatens children in their homes and incidents of anxiety, teen pregnancy and teen suicide grow at an alarming rate. Our kids need help. They need our support. They need to learn how to cope with a maelstrom of emotion, thought  and information that assaults their senses every day. Our children need to learn how to interact within the world so they may recognise and evaluate what they see, hear and feel. This help starts in the home, extends into the classroom and moves beyond to online platforms.  If young adults don’t have the skills to ‘fit in’ the 21st century, if young learners don’t have 21st century literacy tools, if our kids don’t have learning flexibility, they simply will not survive.
Therefore, we want to develop MyQUEST, a fully interactive learning platform for smartphones and tablets. We want to use the latest and greatest in learning technology to help young adults become confident, courageous, creative and compassionate, lifelong learners. MyQuest  is based on the Is This MyStory Learning process. Its innovative design utilises the features of narrative to link gaming technology, animation, interactive pages, film, music, books, blogging, storytelling, social media, global connectivity and much more. MyQuest uses the technology young adults love, to help them develop a focused, flexible approach to learning. With MyQuest, teenagers embark upon a journey toward a critically, emotionally and creatively literate future.
We all know, today’s teens don’t go anywhere without their phones. With MyQuest, they will be carrying 21st century learning tools wherever they go. Perhaps you’d like to think about this – would you prefer your teenager played with slightly upset birds - becoming angrier by the second, or would you like them to recognise their thoughts and manage their emotions while interacting, studying or simply playing with ideas.
With your contributions, we can make this happen. We aim to generate enough funding to breathe life into cutting edge technology that will help teenagers connect and learn in constructive ways. You can help us develop an elite platform which incorporates intricate gaming, detailed illustrations, creative animations and complex interactivity.
As a system, MyQUEST is a 4 Phased learning platform (4 apps) and, even though we have already developed and written the content, the project will cost approximately $150,000 to complete. Nevertheless, we have set an initial target of $25,000. This will help us build Phase 1. All funds will be put toward the cost of developing the software. Of course, we would rather create all 4 phases at once and have set stretch goals in the hope of reaching the total amount. These stretch goals will also allow contributors to access Phases 2-4 and open opportunities for Launch Parties in Melbourne, Brisbane/Gold Coast and hopefully, overseas.
We’d love to come to your city, visit your schools, talk to your teachers , meet you and throw a big bash launch party, especially New York, London, Vancouver or even Honolulu (more information can be found below under Launch Parties).
 
Is This MyStory is an Australian business founded on principals of metacognition and built on the teaching experience of Nicole Feledy, a passionate, innovative English teacher / author who loves stories and genuinely cares about her students. Nicole and the MyStory team have recognised deficiencies within educational systems worldwide.  They see a growing number of students left behind, unable to develop the key skills they require to survive in a technological era.  Nicole and her team want to help. They want to provide tangible strategies that will enable students throughout the world to develop key skills in critical, creative and emotional literacy. These are the 21st century skills our children need to thrive in a time of rapid change.  Imagine 21st century learners with 21st century tools, feeling confident, courageous, creative and compassionate because they are lifelong learners in control of their own learning.  Whether it be in the classroom or simply the action of living life as a 21st century teenager, our children must have the implements of successful learners. Meeting students where they are and providing access to these strategies is the number one goal of Is This MyStory and the MyQUEST Learning project.
 

So how can you get involved?
It’s quite simple! There are two generous ways you can contribute and we hope you will do both:
The first way is extremely simple; just share the word with people you know. Email your family, friends and local schools. Share the link on your blog, FaceBook, Twitter, LinkedIn or any social media site. Share the message with everyone you can think of. The more people who know about MyQUEST, the greater the chance of achieving our goals. For starters you may like to share the link on FaceBook and Twitter now by clicking the icons below our introduction video. Go on, do it now, you know you want to.
The second way to get involved is to pre-purchase MyQUEST by claiming one of the perks on the right hand side of this page. After clicking, you will be asked to confirm your perk and fill in your delivery details (it’s even easier if you’re on FaceBook). You can then choose to contribute using Visa, Amex, Mastercard or Discover (IndieGogo has excellent security to ensure your details are safe). 

You will notice down the right hand side of this page we have designed different contribution levels, or 'perks', to benefit yourself, students and schools around the world - so everyone gets a little something. For example, the $99 Party Time Perk will get you MyQUEST Phase 1, the Is This MyStory eBook, the MyStudy Muse Program, a Mindfulness Session, tickets to the a Launch Party PLUS we will donate 10 MyQuest Phase 1’s to a needy school on your behalf. How good is that? Imagine how much students will appreciate your generosity!
NOTE: If you prefer, we are happy to transfer your gifts to family, friends or students you may know.
Here are your choices:

We appreciate we will have many international contributors and will be happy to accept donations in other currencies including $US, GBP, EU and $CAN. Oh, heck! We will accept any currency. :))

The Is This MyStory eBook is the foundation upon which MyQUEST is built. It is not essential, but an obvious advantage to read the book while venturing along the MyQUEST journey. The eBook will be downloadable upon completion of this campaign.
We estimate completion of MyQUEST by March 2013.

The MyStudy Muse Guided Learning Formula is a 4 week online guided learning exercise which a student completes on a daily basis. Students develop practical strategies to improve their study skills whilst cultivating mental focus and concentration. MyStudy Muse is a 10 step process and compliments the Is This MyStory Learning process.

This is the Launch Pack. We believe it will initially be most popular for those living outside Sydney, Australia. In relation to donating the apps to needy schools, the number of people that choose this perk and the number of students per school will determine the number of schools we can donate to. Keep an eye out for the stretch goals, because once met, we may end up launching in a city near you. If and when this happens you will have the option to upgrade to the Party Time Perk to attend.
Launch Parties are planned to be held upon completion of MyQUEST, so around March 2013. See the Launch Party Section below for more information. At least you’ll have plenty of time to arrange a babysitter!

We predict this perk will be the favourite among Sydney siders.
Your teenagers get the 21st century tools they need, you do your bit for the community, donating MyQUEST to local schools and you get a fun night out.
Unbeatable!
Well that’s not entirely true because we have more contribution levels below which offer even more goodies.

This is as unique as it comes – we are printing a limited edition paperback version of Is This MyStory, with a twist. The current print version features the first names of students Nicole has taught over the years printed on the cover. However the new limited edition will have your full name (or a name of your choice) along with the other 49 contributors embedded, on the cover design. There will only ever be 50 of these made and they will all be signed and personalised for you by Nicole (author). This would make a fantastic birthday or graduation gift for that special teenager. PLUS you receive the Launch Pack and a great night out.

This perk is designed for schools, whether you are a school or would simply like to donate on behalf of a school of your choice. You or the school will still get the Launch Pack and Party tickets and can choose from having Nicole present her spectacular Is This MyStory Interactive Seminar at the school or a 1yr unlimited MyQUEST license for the school. This license will be developed during 2013 and will offer schools greater learning facilities, interactivity and additional features within the MyQUEST platform.

Now you’re really showing some heart! So many schools around Australia rely on government funding to obtain the learning tools students need and quite often funding is insufficient. It would be a dream for us if we could donate at least 10 devices to each of these needy schools. At this perk level we will donate a tablet device with MyQUEST in your name to a local needy school. Plus you still get all the usual extra goodies, WOW!

Another great perk for the school of your choice. The MyQUEST License is better than an individual scholarship as it will benefit every student in the school, not just one. You’d be helping an entire community here.

Similar to the You’re Too Kind Perk plus an added tablet device for yourself (or student of your choice) plus some additional MyQUEST Phases donated in your name. PLUS the best part is becoming a recognised producer in the credits of MyQUEST learning platform (All 4 Phases) – what a golden opportunity.

For the carers that really want to make a difference. This perk is jam packed full of stuff for everyone including extra tablet devices for schools, VIP tickets, domestic flights*, accommodation, MyQUEST school license and much more. And best of all, you will become a recognised executive producer in the MyQUEST learning platform credits (All 4 Phases).
Outstanding, give yourself a pat on the back when you select this one. C’mon do it for the kids!
Please note the flights and accommodation are to be used for the Launch Party and maybe used for your city of choice if different Launch Party Stretch Goals are met.

Never been to OZ, always wanted to come down under? Well here is your chance. Pack your bags, buy some sunscreen and bring a hat. This is the package of a lifetime and we can confirm you’re single handedly changing the world. And best of all you will become a recognised executive producer in the MyQUEST learning platform credits (All 4 Phases).
You’re so exceptional, we may even vote you in as Prime Minister of Australia!
*Domestic and International Flights are direct only, no connections or airport transfers.

If you’re considering funding the entire 4 phase project you definitely are mighty, we’ll cook you Aussie BBQ’s, take you swimming with the sharks, take you hunting for crocodiles, show you the Great Barrier Reef and carry you up Uluru (Ayres Rock). We’ll even buy you a beer!
The question is…is it time to elect the President of Australia?
Simply contact us and we’ll personally collect you in our MyStory ‘jet’.
 
Remember, to share with the FaceBook and Twitter buttons at the top of the page.
 

So what happens next?
The campaign will finish on the Sunday the 16th December 2012.
Now, if we don’t reach our initial goal of $25,000 (unlikely since we have your support), MyQUEST will still be developed, however we may be slightly delayed. We will still honour all perks. Although, we don’t want to focus on not hitting the target as we have complete faith in you sharing our project with everyone you know (and even those you don’t). Did you remember to share our project on FaceBook?
The Is This MyStory eBook and MyStudy Muse will be delivered within 5-10 working days of the campaign ending.
If we only just reach our initial target, MyQUEST Phase 1 will be downloadable after the initial Launch Party, estimated to be in March 2013. If and when stretch goals are met, resective phases will also be available at this time.
The Mindfulness Session will be delivered in early 2013 (Date TBA).
The Limited Edition Is This MyStory books may either be collected at the Launch Party or delivered immediately thereafter.
Launch Party Tickets will be emailed upon confirmation of dates and venues. See below.
Tablet Devices will be delivered once the 4 phases are complete. If all stretch goals are met the 4 phases will be ready for the Launch Parties and available for collection or delivery.
The MyQUEST school licenses we be completed later in 2013 and also rely on the completion of all phases.
Flights and accommodation are only to be used to attend the Launch Parties and will be arranged upon confirmation of Launch Party dates and venues. Every effort will be made to accommodate the travel plans of the contributors.
 

The initial Launch Party will be in Sydney, Australia upon completing the development of phase 1 of MyQUEST - estimated to be in March 2013. We have set stretch goals (see below) which, once reached, will enable us to hold numerous launch parties in different cities. Therefore, we will confirm dates and venues upon completion of the campaign. Obviously, we would like to hold each event on consecutive dates, wherever possible.
 

The initial goal is only set at $25,000 to complete Phase 1, but we really want to complete the full 4 Phased Learning System, which will cost approximately $150,000. Therefore, we have set stretch goals to ensure this will happen and offer you, the contributor greater incentives.
Please note the initial target is to compliment the funding already contributed by Is This MyStory.
Initial Target

Everyone who purchases The Door Opener or greater will receive MyQuest Phase 1 plus all the individual perk inclusions. At this stage, if you live outside Sydney you’ll have to make the trek to be part of the MyQUEST Launch Party.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Anthony Tucker Jr.; I am an upcoming film director, editor, and writer that lives in the small city of Elyria, Ohio. I live with both of my parents; my dad works in a factory. My mom does not work because just a few weeks ago we found out that she was diagnosed with breast cancer. This hit us pretty hard, so I started looking for a job and finally got one at Wal-Mart. It is only seasonal but I have to take what I can get to help my dad with the bills and groceries around the house. I am creating this campaign to raise money for the New York Film Academy. When applying you need a thousand dollar deposit to hold your spot. Since we found out about my mom having breast cancer my dad is not able to pay for it, and the money I get from my job will be used to help around the house with whatever my dad needs. Money is really tight around my household, so if you could help me get the money to apply for the New York Film Academy I will be able to further my education in Film.

What We Need & What You Get

All I am asking for $1500, so I can put $1000 to hold a spot for me at New yYork FIlm Academy. I would use the extra $500 to go visit the school, and go on a tour at the school.

If I am unable to reach my goal I will put the money into a savings account where I will keep trying to save the money I need to apply for the New York Film Academy. I will also help out my family with what is needed around the house.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my fundraiser you can still help. If you could pass my fundraiser around to your friends, or even share my videos around to let everyone know about me. Thank you to all the people who are willing to help me out even if you are unable to contribute to my goal.

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Antoine D. Bates, a Senior business management major at Morehouse College originally from Flint, Michigan. I moved to Atlanta, Ga to pursue my Bachelors degree following in the footsteps of my mentors and my heroes(Dr. Martin Luther King Jr, Dr. Will O. Cobbs, Dr. Robert M. Franklin). From day one at Morehouse I have faced hurdles such as being homeless, jobless, to being kicked out of all my classes after attending school for two weeks due to financial issues, to being on the Dean's list yet only being able to go part time because I could not afford this college out of pocket.

I am a firm believer in never giving up, but sometimes I sit down and cry because I do not know how I am going to be able to fund school and finish this degree. I am asking for $2,500 dollars currently even though tuition is approx. $12,000 per semester and I need to attend two more semesters at full time capacity to graduate. Every dollar earned from this campaign will go directly into my school account so that I can move that much closer to finishing my goal of graduation. I just want my grandmother to look down from heaven and see me cross that stage. I know I can achieve anything I put my mind to, and that I pray into existence, but at this moment I need your help.

Currently I am only taking one course, and this is the only course I was able to take all school year due to my finances. I have no more loans I can take out, and I am not eligible for pell grants. I applied for UNCF Scholarships but the scholarship coordinator at my college felt I didn't put in enough money out of my pocket for her to award me any money, so I was S.O.L. I am part of numerous groups including Morehouse College Safe Space, Beta Gamma Sigma International Honor Society for Business Majors, President of Morehouse College's Golden Key International Honour Society, former member of NAACP, and Morehouse Business Association.


I devote my life and time to giving back to others, and in the past seven years I have worked/volunteered in the field of HIV prevention. I have lived all over and met many people but the one thing that stays constant is HIV is killing people who look just like me everyday and I can't stand and watch people die around me. One reason I am currently working toward my degree is because I want to start my own non profit that deals with housing needs for Gay/ Bisexual/ transgender  HIV positive/ negative individuals. Because across this country there aren't many of these services but they are very much needed. I don't want to start anything without education to build a foundation for success.

I just hope you take a second of your time to donate whatever you can to make my dream a reality. Everybody needs help at some time in your life be that help for me, that I so much need. And always know no good deed goes unrewarded in life. And if you know anyone else that could contribute let them know, I can use all the help that you can give, because sometimes you may not be able to contribute money but just by telling someone else that may be all the help I need. Thank you again, and God Bless.

story:
MY SELF DESCRIPTION AND BACK GROUND

  My name is Pastor Joshua Laizer, I am 44 years old, born in Naisinyai village, Simanjiro district in Tanzania. I got chance to join evangelical college for four years and served as an evangelist for seven years. Later on I joined the university of Makumira for theology, after my graduation, I was blessed installed  to be a pastor among Maasai society. I have been a pastor for the Maasai in Lutheran church Northern diocese constituency of Siha in Karansi Kilimanjaro.

Co-Founder: Pastor Joshua Laiser

 

Co-founder: Frank Swai

Frank Swai is a co-founder of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting this school came after seen Maasai chidren lacks nearest school where they can attend. Also many Maasai families don't take their children to school as they send them to keep their cows and goats. So we are having a big challenge to educate their parents so that they can allow their children to attend school. We want to help Maasai children to have better education so we hope that you will support these children.

 

MY CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT IS IMPORTANT

I, as pastor of Maasai society where education is of low standard and inadequate, I decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL. Already my school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils and grade two with 35 pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Pupils with their teachers when we started under the tree

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

 

 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

My future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground;

Seven (7) more classes @ $5000 x 7 =    $35000

Computer room 1......................................= $5000

Thirty (30) computers @ $500 x 30.....=$15000

One office for teachers ..........................=$5000

Kitchen....................................................= $5000

Toilet........................................................= $5000

Library & books......................................= $9000

Well for keeping water(waterhole)........= $3000

Lunch for 100 students  $1000 per month * 12 months =$12,000

Salaries for 4 teachers @ $300 x 12 x 4 = $14400

Tuition fees for 25 students who their parents can not afford to pay for them @ $700 x 25  =$17500

Total Expansions Costs.......................... $125,900

Desks: We have managed to buy some desks for one class so class one will not sit on the ground again. Please support us so that we can buy more desks and build more classes!!

THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.

Please support our effort!!

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.

 

 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!
story_txt: MY SELF DESCRIPTION AND BACK GROUND  My name is Pastor Joshua Laizer, I am 44 years old, born in Naisinyai village, Simanjiro district in Tanzania. I got chance to join evangelical college for four years and served as an evangelist for seven years. Later on I joined the university of Makumira for theology, after my graduation, I was blessed installed  to be a pastor among Maasai society. I have been a pastor for the Maasai in Lutheran church Northern diocese constituency of Siha in Karansi Kilimanjaro.Co-Founder: Pastor Joshua Laiser Co-founder: Frank SwaiFrank Swai is a co-founder of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting this school came after seen Maasai chidren lacks nearest school where they can attend. Also many Maasai families don't take their children to school as they send them to keep their cows and goats. So we are having a big challenge to educate their parents so that they can allow their children to attend school. We want to help Maasai children to have better education so we hope that you will support these children. MY CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT IS IMPORTANTI, as pastor of Maasai society where education is of low standard and inadequate, I decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL.
