story:
About Me

Hello! For those that don't know me, my name is Xiaohoa Michelle Ching a teacher turned startup founder in Oakland, California. 
I felt overwhelmed, standing in front of my second grade class, looking at seven year olds whose future outcomes depended on my ability in that moment to teach them how to read. If my students couldn’t read by the end of the year it had a direct impact on whether or not they would graduate from high school ten years later. I was determined not to let literacy be a barrier to their future potential.

But, my students literacy skills were drastically different. I feared that I could never be organized enough, have enough time or resources to confidently address their individual reading needs. This struggle was not unique to me. The problem is one that teachers both new and veteran are challenged with.

I needed a solution. I sought out best practices, other tools, but nothing felt right. I needed something that felt natural and unintrusive. It didn’t exist UNTIL we built Literator.

We now have the privilege of being selected as one of the participants of the Millennial Trains Project, a transcontinental train journey for diverse groups of young innovators to explore America’s frontiers, grow as leaders, and launch projects that benefit and inspire their communities. We're excited to bring Literator to more schools and serve more students. Now here’s where I need your help; in order to take part in this week long journey, I will have to crowd fund $5,000 in one week. 
About Millenial Trains Project

½ of US students are failing to read, Literator is here to help.

More than ½ of current US students are projected to drop out of high school because they can't read, according to the National Center for Education Statistics. Reading is so critical to a child's future success, yet teachers are lacking the tools to help them address each child's individual needs: all they have are tests and binders full of notes and guidelines.
Literator is a free tool that supports teachers in understanding, assessing, and addressing a child's reading needs without testing and without after school data entry. Teachers use Literator to guide their literacy instruction as they read with students individually or in small groups. Administrators use the insights gleaned from teacher inputs to alert them to problem areas throughout their organization. 
We need your help to raise $5,000 so we can participate in the Millennial Trains Project and get Literator into classrooms across the country.

How Literator Works


Literator is a mobile app that is both lightweight and unintrusive. It gives teachers just the tools they need at that moment to best help students:

  • Literator shows teachers exactly the skills and prompts they need to help a student at any level, so the teacher doesn't have to memorize all 2,000 skills
  • Literator allows teachers to rate a student's performance with a single swipe, so they don't have to take attention away from the students just to write notes
  • Literator groups students who struggle with the same skills, so teachers can teach in small groups and be more efficient in their instruction


And this is just the beginning! By the end of the summer, Literator will have a more robust dashboard for principals and administrators. Literator will show educators student performance trends and predictions on a daily basis, something that has never been done before. Finally, educators can support students preemptively instead of scrambling to catch kids up right before testing time.

Literator is commited to equity in education.

We’re just getting started but we won’t be finished until we’ve closed the literacy gap - a gap disproportionately impacts students of color and students in poverty. It doesn’t have to be that way. We’ve identified and addressed some of those root causes in how we’ve built Literator. We’re taking the best of technology, user experience design and literacy expertise and bringing easily and affordably into the classroom to give teachers what they need to help students read. We’re changing the future for the kids who have traditionally been left behind because they were too far below their grade level in reading.

Funding

We want to get Literator into the hands of more teachers. We've been honored to be selected by The Millennial Trains Project, which will allow us to meet with educators and influencers all across the country. 

THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is an award-winning 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads transcontinental train journeys for young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers. This an officially-approved campaign for one of MTP's August 2016 journeys.

Contributions toward successful applicant campaigns go directly to MTP to help underwrite expenses associated with the journey (on-train accommodation, meals, and all MTP-related programming activities) and are tax-deductible.


Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you can't donate! We would love if you could spread the word and share our campaign on facebook, twitter, and instagram!

Thank you for all of your support!

Contact Us

Questions? Feedback? Just want to give us a shout out and your support? Contact us at hello@literatorapp.com


Thank you so much, and we're looking forward to helping more teachers and students succeed all across the country.

story:
Elements Co-Founders

Hi! My name is Rachel Medeiros, and last summer my dear friend Cristy O'Brien and I embarked on an amazing project, which needs your help to continue! In 2018 we began with Summer Elements Nature Camp, and had LOADS of fun with more than 40 different children over the course of 8 weeks. We operated at Round The Bend Farm in Dartmouth, MA. where the kids explored the fields, learned about the livestock and vegetables, caught and released numerous toads, caterpillars, beetles and roly-polys, climbed more trees than we could count, and enjoyed the adjacent Audubon Society trails. We had a blast!! We provided 3 children with free or half-cost tuition for a total of 16 weeks between them. Incoming tuition went towards overhead costs and program materials. Everything we did that summer was done by Cristy and myself, volunteering our time to turn our grand vision, into a reality---albeit a scaled-back reality...

Our goal was to make this kind of engaging outdoor program available year-round! For families who didn't want to send their children to schools where they get little to no outdoor playtime...For families who worry about the increased anxiety among elementary students, in this age of standardized testing and rigorous achievement standards...For families with children in the school system who are struggling to keep up, getting bullied, have test-related anxiety, or getting bored because they're advanced.  We want families to have another option, and we want this experience for our own children as well. Donors like you are making this unique and meaningful learning environment accessible for all, regardless of income, by supporting our scholarship fund. 

Cristy and I both come from teaching backgrounds, and in our studies of education and child development, we realized that what we wanted something different for our kids-something that most schools are not providing. We understand the importance of play, and that play, is in fact learning! When children play, they are making meaningful discoveries and connections and developing a deeper understanding of the world around them, and their relationship to it. We understand that children have a variety of learning styles, strengths and weaknesses, and that they need to develop their knowledge and skills at their own individual pace. We worried that even the most skilled and best-intentioned teacher would struggle to provide this for all 20+ students in the classroom.  

Homeschooling appealed to us, and we learned that there is a big community of homeschoolers here on the Southcoast, (over 300 k-12 children in the 8 surrounding towns and cities!!), with  opportunities for meet-ups, co-ops, classes, and events. But something was missing. Something that we felt was very important--a community; a group of children, of varied ages and learning styles and cultures, coming together on a regular basis, to grow and learn together.  We interviewed homeschooling parents, and talked with friends and family, and we found that other parents wanted this too, and many parents dismissed their desire to homeschool because they didn’t know how to find or create their own community. 

We continued to provide Elements Nature Program year round, with a 12 week session for each season. This gives children the time to get to know one another, to develop friendships with someone who they may not have initially approached, to work out disagreements that naturally arise among groups, and to work on projects over the course of the season. We are a young group, of 3-7 year olds, and hope that with continued outreach we will bring in children up to age 10. In future years, we plan to offer programming up to age 18!


By donating to our fundraiser, you make it possible for low-income families to benefit from a meaningful and developmentally appropriate learning experience for their children. One that will benefit their physical, social, and mental well-being for years to come. Donors like you are also making it possible for us to hire experts and skilled people who are able to join us as educational collaborators, to teach children various skills and arts, such as bread-baking, playing instruments, sewing, pottery, archery, soap-making and much more!! Part of our mission is to further develop connections, with children, families with others who are in some way improving our community or maintaining important and valuable skill-sets. 

Funding Breakdown - $30,000

$13,485 - Scholarship Fund (This will provide 1 Full-Cost Scholarships and 2 Half-Cost Scholarships for each season!)

$9,450 - Staff (Outreach & Volunteer Coordinator - 7 hr/wk $4,550/yr, Fundraising Coordinator - 6 hrs/wk $3,900/yr , and Website Design - $1,000)

$3,400 - Collaborators ($100/wk 34 weeks/yr)

$2,000 - Urban Outreach Programs/Events (Rent, Materials, Marketing, Permits - For 3-4 events annually)

$1,665 - Gear (Proper Rain Boots & Shell Pants)

story:
Dear family, friends and kind-hearted contributors,

 

                 I am writing you this letter to bring to your attention a future President of the United States, a surgeon, a lawyer, and/or a leader in whatever area she decides.  My daughter is in the third grade at Baltimore International Academy, which is a language immersion school.  She learns Mandarin Chinese all day at school.  The teacher speaks to her only in Chinese.  She has been studying Chinese for four years.  Her language skills are progressing very well.  When given the chance she can participate in a fluent conversation.  We are aware that a lot of her time in school is spent learning Chinese so after school, of course after homework, she has a schedule of math, spelling, Rosetta Stone. 

                Aniya performs in the top of her class.  She has been awarded the President’s Award two years in a row.  She has received awards because of her ability to excel on the YCT, young learners Chinese test.  To say that I am proud is an understatement.  At the age of nine, she has already performed for the Mayor of Baltimore and the President of China.  Not only is she a scholar, but she also excels in sports.  She participates in several rec sports including soccer, basketball, and several others.  She also competes in AAU track, basketball and most recently swimming.  While on the track team she shined in the shot put.   She is approaching her second year in swimming and continues to learn and implement several great habits like hard work, determination, perseverance, and respect.

                Aniya’s teacher recently nominated her for the National Young Scholars Program.   The National Young Scholars Program accepts high-achieving elementary students to attend this hands-on educational and leadership program.  This will be a great experience that will help Aniya build her leadership skills and learn all about ­­­engineering, medicine: the human body, and crime scene investigation.  Many of you have children, nieces, nephews, god-children or work with children on a daily basis and many of you many not.  I can guarantee that in your life you have come across at least one child who as entered into your heart.  Giving children opportunities to grow is emotionally fulfilling.   If I could give endless to my child I would, but I can’t  as funds are finite.  So, I call on the village for help.  

                The teacher that nominated her apologized after realizing the cost of the summer camp.  I am glad that she was not aware of the cost at the time because otherwise my daughter might not have been given the opportunity.  I am reaching out to family, friends and the community for support.  Any assistance is greatly appreciated.   Thank you for your ear and hopefully your support.

Miranda Morton-Carrington

Proud Parent

story:
The next twelve weeks could be your most inspiring, 
purposeful and successful 12 Weeks of your life!
...or
They could be just another 12 weeks

Your choice!

That's what the Autus Buddy-Up Succes program can offer people.
 
BUT Imagine what it could do for our High School Students
in their Graduating Year of School!
 
 

 
But First A  Bit About Me!

After twenty three years of research, four years of writing, re-writing, editing and formatting, I have completed one of the world's most unique personal success programs. But before I tell you about that, first a bit about me!

My name is Mark Craymer, I'm almost fifty, I'm a married father of three adult children, (that may sound like a contradiction but that's how I put it).
I served in the Navy for 11 years, since leaving in 1990, I have owned and operated my own businesses.
I'm not perfect, I have failed more times than I care to admit, but I kept going, learning from each and every experience, good and bad. 

I was always looking for the secret to success, always searching for a shortcut to get what I wanted.
What I discovered over the past 23 years was that there are no short cuts, no secrets, just a simple step by step process to create the lifestyle you want. 

Seven years ago I was coaching people one on one to help them achieve the same success that I have enjoyed over the years. 
If you have ever looked at hiring a success coach, you would know that they're not cheap, in fact it can be very expensive , I was no different.
Unfortunately the people who needed my help most, weren't able to afford my services.
I coached a few clients for free as they really needed help, and didn't have the money to hire my services, but I could only spread myself so far. 

So after much deliberation I decided put my 'one on one' coaching on hold, and made the decision to create a Success program that many people could afford, and still get the same amazing results using my methods. However, what makes my program different from many others, is that you don't do it all on your own, you will have help from your very own coach, someone to cheer you on, bounce ideas off and importantly, keep you accountable to your goals and ensure that you keep moving forward.

Now don't worry, this coach, (which I call in this program, your 'Success Buddy' ),won't cost you a penny! But more about that soon.

What is this Success Program?

You could liken it to a giant awakening! It would be like your mind has just woken from many years of slumber and all of a sudden, opportunities seem to cross your path readily, ideas come to you easily and your level of self confidence in your ability to achieve anything is at it's highest level yet.

You'll create a vision of what your new life is going become, and a road map on how you are going to get there. It all starts with my step by step, 12 week program, upon completion of which, you'll progress tonto a 90 Day goals achievement program. 
 
What you'll discover in this program is that within each of us, there lies a seed of greatness! The Autus Buddy-Up Success Program will help you realise what that seed is and how to nurture and grow it, to allow you to become someone who gets to do what they love in life and be rewarded extremely well for it!
You will embark upon the game of life with more vigour than ever before, you will be brimming with purpose, fullfilment and experience much joy as you progress along the journey of self discovery.
You will be in the 'process' of being successful, and as you will learn in this program, a by-product of success is wealth, financial independence!
 
 
How It Works!
 
 
I mentioned before that you'll have the services of a 'Success-Buddy', to help you through this program. The great thing about your Success-Buddy is that you don't have to pay him or her any money! 
Because your success buddy, is going to be a friend of yours, a work colleague, a relative or even your partner.
Of course , in turn you will become your partner's Success-Buddy as well!
 
The only pre-requisite for a success-buddy, is that they also have a strong desire to make massive improvements in their life and break free of what may be a mundane existence. 
You and your success-buddy will both progress through this program together each week for the first 12 weeks and then move into the massive goal achievement phase which are broken into 90 Day segements, at this point you and your success-buddy will be meeting each fortnight. 

You will learn how to coach each other and become an effective coach/Success-Buddy using the 'Buddy Guide' that has been written for this program.
 
I won't get into too much detail here but one thing you must know is, that it is extremely hard to achieve great things and break out of your current lifestyle without some help, and I'm talking 'structured help'. Look at the most successful people in the world today, they all have people around them supporting, and coaching them onto greater things.
You are no different! You will have your 'Success Buddy', and your Success Buddy will have you.
 
 
My BIG Goal and Why I Need Your Help?

 When I first began writing this program four years ago, I was creating it for the same type of people who I was coaching. They were people who through no fault of their own, were 'stuck in a rut', they had lost their way and they were working hard, day in day out, week in week out, to merely 'eke' out a living for themselves and their family.
I created this program to help those same people to create a lifestyle of their own choosing, not the one they are currently struggling in. So the people who I wrote this program for were mature, working adults from 25 years old and upwards.

However, I also now see that there exists a definite need for this program in another very important area of our community. That being our young students commencing their final year in High School.

I remember when I was in my last year of high school, I had absolutely no idea what I was going to do!
My safety blanket of 12 years was going to be pulled away from me and I would have to fend for myself, what the hell was I going to do!
Now I bet many students in their final year of high school have similar thoughts racing around in their head!

I believe that if I could get this program, (although a modified version to pertain to 16 - 18 year olds), into high schools the world over, I/We, could create an impact on millions of students in their final year of school.
Imagine, these students leaving school brimming with self confidence armed with an, 'I Can Do It' attitude, a passion for life, a set of worthwhile goals to achieve, AND a 'road map' on how they are going to achieve them!
As the motivational speaker and trainer, Zig Ziglar would put it, we would have a healthy population of high school graduates that have become, 'Meaningful Specifics' rather than 'Wandering Generalities'!


Now it's time to hand it over to you!
 
Help this project and at the same time help yourself too!

 
I have a number of contribution levels available for you, each one of them gives you something in return. The money raised via this campaign will help me to acheive my goal of getting this program out into High Schools all over the world.
 
Initially I will be re-writing/editing the program so it pertains more to a teenage audience.

Next will be the creation of their own 'community based' website, where they can interact with other students, no matter where they are in the world.
They can share ideas, stories and help each other with challenges and obstacles that they will face as they progress through the program.
It will also be on this website whereby students will be able to download the program for themselves

Next comes the marketing, and the creation and distribution of information packages regarding the Autus Buddy-Up Success program. This is the one I'm going to need some help with and it will probably come at a cost.
But I have been committed to this program for four years now and have dedicated thousands of hours into it and almost $45,000 of my own money. I won't ever give up in getting this program into the hands of people who can reallt benefit from it, especially our youth!

Please help me to help others achieve their dreams and

Dream BIG!    Live BIG!
story_txt:
The next twelve weeks could be your most inspiring, 
purposeful and successful 12 Weeks of your life!
...or
They could be just another 12 weeks

Your choice!

That's what the Autus Buddy-Up Succes program can offer people.

 
BUT Imagine what it could do for our High School Students
in their Graduating Year of School!

 

 

 
But First A  Bit About Me!

After twenty three years of research, four years of writing, re-writing, editing and formatting, I have completed one of the world's most unique personal success programs. But before I tell you about that, first a bit about me!

My name is Mark Craymer, I'm almost fifty, I'm a married father of three adult children, (that may sound like a contradiction but that's how I put it).
I served in the Navy for 11 years, since leaving in 1990, I have owned and operated my own businesses.
I'm not perfect, I have failed more times than I care to admit, but I kept going, learning from each and every experience, good and bad. 
I was always looking for the secret to success, always searching for a shortcut to get what I wanted.
What I discovered over the past 23 years was that there are no short cuts, no secrets, just a simple step by step process to create the lifestyle you want. 

Seven years ago I was coaching people one on one to help them achieve the same success that I have enjoyed over the years. 
If you have ever looked at hiring a success coach, you would know that they're not cheap, in fact it can be very expensive , I was no different.
Unfortunately the people who needed my help most, weren't able to afford my services.
I coached a few clients for free as they really needed help, and didn't have the money to hire my services, but I could only spread myself so far. 


So after much deliberation I decided put my 'one on one' coaching on hold, and made the decision to create a Success program that many people could afford, and still get the same amazing results using my methods. However, what makes my program different from many others, is that you don't do it all on your own, you will have help from your very own coach, someone to cheer you on, bounce ideas off and importantly, keep you accountable to your goals and ensure that you keep moving forward.


Now don't worry, this coach, (which I call in this program, your 'Success Buddy' ),won't cost you a penny! But more about that soon.

What is this Success Program?

You could liken it to a giant awakening! It would be like your mind has just woken from many years of slumber and all of a sudden, opportunities seem to cross your path readily, ideas come to you easily and your level of self confidence in your ability to achieve anything is at it's highest level yet.

You'll create a vision of what your new life is going become, and a road map on how you are going to get there. It all starts with my step by step, 12 week program, upon completion of which, you'll progress tonto a 90 Day goals achievement program. 

 
What you'll discover in this program is that within each of us, there lies a seed of greatness! The Autus Buddy-Up Success Program will help you realise what that seed is and how to nurture and grow it, to allow you to become someone who gets to do what they love in life and be rewarded extremely well for it!
You will embark upon the game of life with more vigour than ever before, you will be brimming with purpose, fullfilment and experience much joy as you progress along the journey of self discovery.
You will be in the 'process' of being successful, and as you will learn in this program, a by-product of success is wealth, financial independence!

 

 
How It Works!

 

 
I mentioned before that you'll have the services of a 'Success-Buddy', to help you through this program. The great thing about your Success-Buddy is that you don't have to pay him or her any money! Because your success buddy, is going to be a friend of yours, a work colleague, a relative or even your partner.
Of course , in turn you will become your partner's Success-Buddy as well!

 
The only pre-requisite for a success-buddy, is that they also have a strong desire to make massive improvements in their life and break free of what may be a mundane existence. 
You and your success-buddy will both progress through this program together each week for the first 12 weeks and then move into the massive goal achievement phase which are broken into 90 Day segements, at this point you and your success-buddy will be meeting each fortnight. 
You will learn how to coach each other and become an effective coach/Success-Buddy using the 'Buddy Guide' that has been written for this program.

 
I won't get into too much detail here but one thing you must know is, that it is extremely hard to achieve great things and break out of your current lifestyle without some help, and I'm talking 'structured help'. Look at the most successful people in the world today, they all have people around them supporting, and coaching them onto greater things.
You are no different! You will have your 'Success Buddy', and your Success Buddy will have you.

 

 
My BIG Goal and Why I Need Your Help?


 When I first began writing this program four years ago, I was creating it for the same type of people who I was coaching. They were people who through no fault of their own, were 'stuck in a rut', they had lost their way and they were working hard, day in day out, week in week out, to merely 'eke' out a living for themselves and their family.

I created this program to help those same people to create a lifestyle of their own choosing, not the one they are currently struggling in. So the people who I wrote this program for were mature, working adults from 25 years old and upwards.

However, I also now see that there exists a definite need for this program in another very important area of our community. That being our young students commencing their final year in High School.

I remember when I was in my last year of high school, I had absolutely no idea what I was going to do!
My safety blanket of 12 years was going to be pulled away from me and I would have to fend for myself, what the hell was I going to do!
Now I bet many students in their final year of high school have similar thoughts racing around in their head!

I believe that if I could get this program, (although a modified version to pertain to 16 - 18 year olds), into high schools the world over, I/We, could create an impact on millions of students in their final year of school.
Imagine, these students leaving school brimming with self confidence armed with an, 'I Can Do It' attitude, a passion for life, a set of worthwhile goals to achieve, AND a 'road map' on how they are going to achieve them!
As the motivational speaker and trainer, Zig Ziglar would put it, we would have a healthy population of high school graduates that have become, 'Meaningful Specifics' rather than 'Wandering Generalities'!


Now it's time to hand it over to you!

 

Help this project and at the same time help yourself too!




 
I have a number of contribution levels available for you, each one of them gives you something in return. The money raised via this campaign will help me to acheive my goal of getting this program out into High Schools all over the world.
 
Initially I will be re-writing/editing the program so it pertains more to a teenage audience.

Next will be the creation of their own 'community based' website, where they can interact with other students, no matter where they are in the world.
They can share ideas, stories and help each other with challenges and obstacles that they will face as they progress through the program.
It will also be on this website whereby students will be able to download the program for themselves


Next comes the marketing, and the creation and distribution of information packages regarding the Autus Buddy-Up Success program. This is the one I'm going to need some help with and it will probably come at a cost.


But I have been committed to this program for four years now and have dedicated thousands of hours into it and almost $45,000 of my own money. I won't ever give up in getting this program into the hands of people who can reallt benefit from it, especially our youth!


Please help me to help others achieve their dreams and

Dream BIG!    Live BIG!

story:
Pigzbe is a (very) smart device that teaches kids 6+ the value of money in a digital world. It's one of the first ever family products built using the blockchain.

We call it a piggy-wallet™. 

Today’s kids live in a fast-changing financial world. Digital money, contactless payments, in-app purchases and cryptocurrency are all things they need help to understand.

It's hard to get to grips with money if you can’t touch the notes or feel the coins!

We wanted to find a way to make digital money physical, so children can touch, play and experiment with it. The same way we did with the coins in our piggy-banks. 

Pigzbe teaches kids about money in a language they understand. It is made up of four connected elements:

 1. Pigzbe Device 

Pigzbe is a friendly and interactive financial assistant that’s packed with personality. Take Pigzbe on adventures, play games and learn together as you grow up. 

2. Pigzbe App

The Pigzbe App connects the whole family to a child’s financial education. Parents can send allowances, set tasks & reward milestones. Kids learn through play.

 

3. Wollo, a family-friendly cryptocurrency 

Using Wollo kids learn how to save, budget and manage digital money. Every new Pigzbe comes with 200 Wollo inside, enough to start having fun right away!

 

4. Family Payment Card

Spend Wollo easily anywhere that takes Visa using our Family Payment Card. Or spend Wollo using a Wirex Visa card (both cards available in selected locations, additional fees apply). 

In the Parents App, Mum and Dad moderate. They can set allowances, create tasks to earn money, reward milestones, and invite others to join the family network. 

The Kids App is an interactive game. It allows children to feed their money tree, watch it grow, and learn new financial concepts as they play. 

Lots of parents struggle to talk to their children about finances and worry about passing on bad habits. Pigzbe helps create a more positive family dynamic around money.  Kids learn: 

Wollo is our family-friendly cryptocurrency, designed specifically to send money globally, quickly and cost-effectively (it costs $0.000001 to send as little as $0.005).   

 

Where do I get Wollo?  

Every Pigzbe device comes with 200 Wollo inside, enough for parents to get started setting tasks and giving rewards. You can buy more Wollo online like any other currency. 

 

How does Wollo work?

Wollo works like any other currency – it has an exchange rate and you can buy it with dollars, pounds or other cryptocurrencies. Like any other currency it can go up and down in price.

Fluctuation is an important financial concept to learn (the dollar does it, the pound does it) so introducing children to this idea with very small amounts of money, is a useful lesson.

How can I spend Wollo?

You can spend Wollo by exchanging it online for other digital or everyday currencies or using a Pigzbe Family Payment Card or Wirex Visa card (selected locations, fees apply). 

Pigzbe comes with all the necessary parts to start playing right out of the box: A. Pigzbe Piggy-Wallet, B. Pigzbe App (Parents App + Kids App), C. USBC Charging chord 

Lights! Sound! Touch! D. 128 LED lights, combined with a E. speaker, a F. vibration motor, and G. 2x buttons, to provide a tangible window into your digital money.  

We're a team of engineers, technologists, artists and storytellers from 15 countries. We've worked on incredible projects for companies like Apple, Google and NASA. We know what it means to deliver exceptional experiences to millions of people. 

Pigzbe is our next big adventure.  

We worked with the amazing team at Pentagram, the world's largest independent design consultancy, to build a truly unique product.  

Pigzbe runs on a Dual core XTENSA® 32-bit LX6 with AES/RSA/ECC/SHA hardware encryption. It has a 24 x 8 LED matrix display, 6-axis motion sensing and works with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. 

Everything is ready to go. We just need your support. Pigzbe will be in stores in Q2 2019. Back us on Indiegogo and be among the first in the world to get one!   

We’re a team of Mums (and Moms) and Dads who have built some of the world’s best-loved educational toys, things like  Cubetto, the Kano, SAM, Hack-a-Ball, and Suzy Snooze. We know from experience how kids learn.

Collectively, we’ve produced and delivered robots, computers and connected devices across multiple Kickstarter and Indiegogo campaigns since 2013. Meet the team here.

Some might say we’re crowdfunding veterans. 

There’s no secret about the challenges involved in delivering bits and atoms, but we know what we are doing. 

We give you our word and guarantee that every backer will receive a quality product made with skill, dedication and passion.

We're so sure about Pigzbe that we are offering a 100% Delivery Guarantee. If we fail to deliver the rewards for whatever reason, we will reimburse the full amount you pledged on Indiegogo. 

 

Thanks for reading!

Team Pigzbe x

story:
Biola London

Studying in England has been one of my dreams since before even coming to college. Now that I have been accepted to Biola's London program, I find it hard to believe that its here. Come this fall I will be leaving for the semester and taking advanced Psychology classes at Roehampton University.  I just need a little more help from all of you that have been supportive since the beginning! 

What I Need & What You Get

Because of the high cost of living in England, I need to save as much money as I can for bare necessities, like food, books, and transportation. I will be working all summer to save up for those, which will take up most of my funds. The biggest expense I need to worry about however, is the plane ticket, and they to average out at around 1800-1900 US dollars. Being realistic, my summer job won't allow me to pay for necessities and a plane ticket, and anyway I can help my parents financially is a huge burden off their shoulders.

What I need: 

  • Prayer! Please pray that God will continue to provide. Pray that my time over there will be a blessing to my flatmates, my family, and my peers. Pray that I could be a light and show Jesus' love.  Pray for safe travels, a safe visit, and a productive, fun, and enriching time. 

  • ANY amount donation helps! No matter what I raise, I will get the money. If I don't make my goal, they will take out more interest from the grand total. (9% vs the 4% if goal is met) 
What you get:

  • No matter the amount, you will get a had written thank you letter if you provide your address! 
  • Donations of $50 or more, will get a handwritten, and hand drawn thank you letter with a one of a kind Sonja original art piece on it! No card will be the same. 


The Impact

I am going to London to impact not only myself but those I will come in contact with. 

  • Roehampton is not a Christian University. I intend to be intentional with the individuals I come in contact with there. Not only will I be going for myself and my schooling, but I consider this an opportunity to glorify God with my studies and friendships I will be building.
  • This is the opportunity of a lifetime. The real world skills I will be gaining from experiencing a new country essentially on my own will be invaluable.

story:
I've been accepted into the Paralegal program at a local college, and I possess the natural gifts to succeed as a student, and as a paralegal - I just don't have the money.
I'm a single parent, and an online Avon lady (Shop my store at www.youravon.com/darlenewaters and get free, super-fast direct delivery anywhere in the contiguous U.S., and just pay a small fee for AK and HI.) and my son just turned 18, so I really want to GO FOR IT!
I am a logical, rational thinker, with a strong sense of ethics, and anyone who knows me would tell you that I would be an asset to any law firm.
I will start my classes in May, 2014, and my tuition bill will be due shortly after classes start.
I hope you will be a part of my success by contributing funds and by helping me to spread the word about my goal. 
Thank you.

story:
Hi my name is Damian Murray and i live in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. I am trying to raise money to spread awareness of the 9/11 truth movement which is headed by the families and Architects & Engineers for 9/11 Truth. I have put their 1 hour edited documentary here so you can see the science behind the 9/11 truth movement. For additional information you there are many documentaries out there but the 2 best are, '9/11 A New Pearl Harbor' and 'Loose Change An American coup' which are both available free online.

With the donations, the plan is to hopefully put a billboard up in Melbourne of one of the Architects & Engineers for 9/11 Truth designs with important information. For example the, 'Did you know a 3rd tower fell on 9/11?' billboard put up in america. I would love to hear ideas of what would be most effective design, the best location and pricing options. I have had a look and we would like to at least get a one month billboard at a train station which will cost around $5000 all up.

I strongly believe that this is an important movement, because a lot of what is going on in the world is connected to that day and history will repeat itself. Let's find the truth through a real investigation as the 9/11 commission was a whitewash, and find out the truth of what happened that day. Let's make this a better world for the global community and generations to come.

story:
Summer's coming...

And you know what that means: kids trapped inside with nothing to do except jump off your furniture and drive you apey bananas.

We can fix that.  But we need your help.

Our ultimate goal is to raise $100,000 to help build a FREE splashpark for Denton's kids.  With this current campaign to raise $3,500 by May, combined with previous fundraisers for this project, we will end up just over the $10K mark. (Not too shabby considering how new this initiative is!)  Bit by bit, we will raise enough money to build a splashpark for all of Denton to enjoy -- regardless of income level or physical ability.  We will ALL be able to cool off and play together for free all summer long!

Splashparks are cheaper to maintain than community pools, and can be open during the school year, early in the morning, and later in the evening (a time when most municipally owned pools are closed).  And unlike the Civic Center pool or Natatorium, this facility would be FREE, so that all children across our community would be able to access it.

Want to join our mailing list?  Sign up here http://eepurl.com/FcnSD

Have something you'd like to contribute as a perk for this campaign?  Would your business be willing to host a fundraiser?  Contact us at splashpark.denton@gmail.com

Together we can do this!  #dentoning

story:
Recently, I was invited to Kigali, Rwanda by the Rebecca Davis Dance Company to teach dance to underprivileged children. The Rebecca Davis Dance Company (RDDC) is a not-for-profit organization based in the United States that carries out arts programs for underserved youth in post-conflict and developing countries. Currently, the company is active in three countries: Bosnia-Herzegovina, Guinea and Rwanda. Each program uses dance to engage children in a physical activity that is then followed by an educational component.  

During my trip to Rwanda, I noticed the necessity of education that these children were not afforded. They possessed so many great talents and intuition that have not yet been nurtured. Many of them have become the head of their households, sent to prison, are recovering alcoholics, drug users, and survivors of the genocide in 1994 at a very young age. I found that these children have not had the opportunity to be children. Through this program, it allowed them to explore artistic freedom, to have a safe environment, and to assure them positive self-discipline.

The children of Rwanda are in desperate need of financial help to support their educational fees. RDDC created a website (www.rwandayouth.com) which is designed to give the youth a free voice to communicate with people around the world about their life experience through an artistic realm. It serves as a catalyst for others to realize how worthy it is to invest in underprivileged children. Together, with a love of dance and physical expression, funds collected will further the mental development of street children by giving them a chance to go to school.

story:
The Background

Some of you might be aware, some of you might not be, but I am currently in my fourth year of architecture at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, New York. Even though at this point in the year most students are gearing up for graduation, architecture school is a 5 year program for a BA. Not only that, but they expect us to handle a 3rd 400 level design course(more on what that means later) and our thesis research at the same time in our fall semester of 5th year. Under most circumstances I would say toughen up Zach you can do it, and I very much so could, however I also need to be able to work 18 plus hours a week in order to pay New York City rent. So that is where a summer design course comes into the equation. I have been one of 10 selected for a summer design course for summer 2011 that starts in the third week of May. Luckily it's not just any summer design course, it's a summer design course taught by Jonas Coersmeier with a seminar class taught by Gisela Baurmann both of BüroNY Architecture Office, also half of which is conducted in Berlin, Germany, which just happens to be on my list of cities to consider locating to after graduation upon completion of my 5th year at Pratt. However as always there is a downside to such a great program, and that is an elevated cost. This coupled with the lack of financial aid offered for summer courses leaves me stuck, but maybe not if you guys have something to say.


The Program

At Pratt and most other "Design" schools, architecture students are required to take a Design each semester they are enrolled. Your first year starts highly abstract, getting a grasp of the ideas/tools/techniques of being a designer, and as you progress getting more and more real, until your thesis where you can flip it however you choose fit. 400 level design is known as "option studios" meaning that there is no set program, site, and pedagogy for the entire 400 level, but professors and students form their own, which ends up allowing most of the abroad programs to insert themselves into these 400 level design courses. Specifics on architectural program and site of the project are not yet set, but this will be updated as they are provided. Pedagogy I can touch, but I in no way would like to step on Jonas' toes on this, so I'll keep it brief. I have previously taken a design course with him, and it proved to be one of the most demanding experiences in my education so far, but also yielded successful results. His interests align with mine(I feel so anyways) that program needs to be engineered and not laid out. He also brings technology to the forefront to be utilized as a tool, not a representational ornament. I learned a great deal from that one semester, but I know I can learn an infinite amount more.

The Impact

Your contributions will help all of these things come to fruition. It is very important to me that I can focus on my last design course without the distractions of thesis and work, combining to make the fall an unpleasant experience, and worst of all a potential waste of a design course and thesis research, the two things rounding out my portfolio coming out of school. As I previously said, Berlin is also at the top of my list of places to locate to after completing my BA at Pratt, and this would be a great opportunity to also feel the city out and whether it can be the right fit, as well as visiting offices to layout a plan to facilitate such a move. Also on a side note, I have never even been out of the United States that wasn't a family trip to Mexico, so this will erase many bucket list style items.


The Expenses

Figures aren't exact at the moment so I will provide estimates given to me, and update them when needed.

Tuition - $1,200 per credit x 8 credits

Hostel - $800 for whole trip

Food/living - $50 per week x 6 weeks(in Berlin, in Brooklyn I'll be working so no cost factored in)

typical model/drawing supplies - $250 per semester

Airfare - $1000


I know what you're saying, "Yikes Zach that's a lot of money" and yes, yes it is, however I will be trying my best to help you guys help me, by applying to any and all scholarships that will let me over the next couple of months, so if you find some, that helps too, send them my way. If we overshoot? you ask, well that would be just AMAZING, and if that were the case, many many thanks would be given, the money however would go directly to making payments on my family and I's already ridiculous loans for my very expensive private school education.

The Non-Donation Based Help

Don't have money to give? thats fine too, I'm clearly in no position to judge you on that, however if you could share this site and other links with whoever you might think be interested, really, anybody at all, facebook/twitter/shoot I'll even accept 4chan publicity, just get it out there. Also if you come across any scholarships that might be applicable to me, just forward me the information so I can apply in a timely matter.


Thank you all so much for taking the time to even browse to this page, I hope we can make this happen!


-Zachary Chapman

 chapmanzepl@gmail.com

story:
Overview :

Teach your kids 8+ to start learning electric circuits with Playtronics Circuit Book and addon Kits. Kids will learn about the circuits in a step-wise manner that enables them to think critically, solve problems,  use creativity and apply the learnings in a practical way with our DIY Circuit book. 

Your child can Learn simple to complex circuits, Use their Imagination and can build their own products. Build Anything, your Imagination is your Limitation.

Add-on kits.

DIY Paper Circuits

Creative Drawings 

Practical Add-ons 

Easy to use

Safe to use

STEAM Education

State of the art design

Guaranteed Delivery within 5-11 business days.

 

Follow us on Facebook | twitter | Linkedin

 

 

What is Playtronics Circuit Book?


Playtronics Circuit Book helps children learn electric circuits in an easy and flexible way with Safe to use materials. The KIT is Intuitive and develops Critical Thinking among the kids.

Book consists of different Circuits with creative drawings that explains types of Circuits and Four Add-on Kits with practical applications.

 

 

How does it work?

It's simple!

Step 1: Sketch the drawing.

Step 2: Build the Circuit.


Step 3: Play and learn.


Step 4: Build a Practical Product. 

City Kit


 

Origami Kit

 

Torch Kit

 

 

How is it different?

Making electronic circuits in a traditional way using wires and soldering is a vigorous struggle. Thus we made the process of building basic circuits easy and flexible using paper circuits. It gives a practical application approach at the front end where the paper circuit is its backend.

 

What will kids learn?

Practical School frameworks transform STEM education to STEAM education. Children will learn to use creativity, Art, think critically and solve problems.

 

It prepares students to work in a field that is poised for growth. STEAM education that focuses on teaching children to solve real-world problems in an engaging and collaborative learning process.

 

It Imparts basics of circuits in a practical way.

Kids will learn what is Voltage, Current and various basic concepts of electric circuits.

 

Book is designed in such a way that it covers all simple to complex circuits.

 

About the Kit

Playtronics Circuit Book Kit comes with the following :

Circuit Book 

Circuit Tape - conducting tape which sticks on to the book

Glow Gems LEDs - 20 Nos

Resistors - 21 Nos

Coin Cell Battery - 4 Nos

Buzzer - 1 

Paper Clips - 1 

Paper Switches - 20 Nos

Torch Kit - 1

Origami Night Lamp Kit- 1

Circuit City Kit- 1

Crown Kit- 1

The product is designed in such a way that is simple and flexible, yet powerful enough to impart basics of circuits in a practical way

 

 

 

 

Add On's 

 

 

 

 

Practical School AR App

 


 

Children can learn the concepts of circuits in a self-learning environment with the help of our AR App that contains video tutorials and AR (augmented reality) that makes the whole learning process fun and easy

 

 

*App launching soon on Google Playstore and Appstore.

About Us

 

Irusu practical school will be bringing a series of wholly new products that are based on steam education which will focus on teaching children to solve real-world problems through an engaging and collaborative learning process.

 

We are building an ecosystem that itself will become a learning platform that incorporates most of the existing and future science and tech.

 



Our Team : 

Highly Efficient team with expertise in product design and development.

story:
To all Montessori alumni and supporters across the nation - we invite you to invest in Montessori training for public school teachers. The Garden Oaks Montessori PTO is a nonprofit organization of committed parents, teachers and community members dedicated to strengthening our school community, as well as other Montessori schools. While this initiative will begin at Garden Oaks Montessori, we hope to eventually reach across the Greater Houston area to engage and educate potential Montessori teachers.

At Garden Oaks Montessori (a public pre-k, elementary and middle school campus in Houston, Texas) we believe in engaging the child in activities that promote:

  • Authentic problem-solving
  • Critical-thinking, reasoning and decision-making
  • A rigorous core curriculum including environmental  sciences
  • Communicating for a variety of purposes
  • Applying digital technologies
  • Developing social and academic responsibility

So that we empower our children with 21st Century tools to communicate and advocate for our Earth and themselves.

We cannot realize this vision without the strength of trained and certified Montessori teachers! Training for Montessori educators is not a part of a public school budget. These dedicated and passionate teachers are often paying over $5,000 out of their own pockets to cover the cost. With your help we can provide them with financial assistance. Your investment will prepare the leaders of tomorrow.

It has been said that as many as 85% of the jobs that this generation of children will have as adults have not been invented yet, in large part due to the automation of many existing jobs. Montessori teaches critical thinking, organization, intrinsic motivation, creativity, empathy, and social responsibility among scores of other “soft skills” that are highly desirable even by employers today and will be critical for the jobs of tomorrow.  In short, the Montessori method teaches the skills required for our future leaders. Thank you in advance for your support! No gift is too small and all funds will be spent on teacher training.

story:
Community Leaders, Activist, and Friends, 

In times like these it breaks my heart to see students, our future leaders struggling. I just got off the phone with Dr. Yasmin Delahoussaye, the executive director of Educational Student Tours: Black College Tours. She is in the trenches day in and day out for her students since COVID-19 hit our world... working to get black foster & low income (with $35k annual household incomes or less) high school & college students the basics especially since COVID-19 impacted our world. Since 1987, this nonprofit organization has been helping many youth achieve their dreams in achieving degrees in STEM-related fields & has received a platinum rating on Guide Star. 

Here are some of the current situations of students:

-Many former foster youth do not have a laptop or computer. With colleges moving all their classes online, they face the prospect of having to drop out. 

-Some foster students are now homeless because they have been asked to vacate the dorms.

-Utilities have been turned off, and students can’t afford groceries.  

-Low-income students lost their jobs and are on food stamps. Some do not qualify for unemployment and still have to pay rent.  

I know times are tough for many, and if it is in your heart/means and you would like to contribute financially, we would really appreciate it. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this email & allowing me to bring awareness to this worthy organization. 

In Solidarity,


Alexis Small

story:
About Beat Shop: We have established beat labs on both coasts with the intention of bringing current music trends and professional music technology to people of all ages, with an emphasis on youth. Sponsored by Propellerheads Reason Software, Berklee College of Music, and Keith McMillan Instruments, we started at the Community Music Center of Boston in 2010, added a program at the Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts in San Francisco in 2012, built a studio at the Oakland School for the Arts in January of 2014, and built another studio at the San Francisco School for the Arts in September of 2014. We are currently in contact with La Guardia High School of Music and Art in Manhattan, NY, Brooklyn High School of the Arts in Brooklyn, NY, and Frank Sinatra School of the Arts in Queens, NY.

        Our curriculum focuses on chord theory and harmony using MIDI keyboards, playback exercises, and music notation. Our main goal is to make music easy to understand and fun to compose. We wrote a method book that utilizes jazz and classical compositions, advanced music theory, and jazz piano voicings that we coupled with software exercises to teach theory, keyboard skills, composition and arranging. In our advanced composition class at the Oakland and San Francisco School of the Arts, we have had incredible results teaching 12 thru 18 year-olds to read lead sheets, improvise, and compose their own music.

        Our goal is $1,000, which is half of the projected budget of one beat lab (around $2,000). Please help us raise money to build new labs in New York for 2015!

story:
Our Story

(Black Men United is a community based support group to assist young men getting into the work force.

The Impact

We provide training workshops to confirm for the young men (13-19) how to complete a resume/application for employment. Role play with the young men to how to complete interview, how to dress for success.

What We Need & What You Get

5000.00 is a start to what we need, we help young men complete GED(if needed). So we pay for the training to complete, the biggest part of expense comes with purchasing clothes to complete the dress for success. (ie, shirt/tie, haircut,belts)

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
My Story

My name is Ashley Winnard and I am a Linguistics major at the University of Oklahoma. For those of you that are unsure, or simply don't know, Linguistics is the comprehensive study of human language systems across the world. While most linguists study specific languages and are sometimes bi- or trilingual, the bulk of our studies involves the mechanics of human language: the individual sounds and sound patterns within language (the p's, t's and k's of any alphabet), sentence structure (intense grammar), semantics (meaning in words and communication), language change over time (how English and German are related, and how words like 'werewolf' came to be) and language death. The University of Oklahoma is the only university in Oklahoma that offers Linguistics and is also the leading university in the nation in preserving and documenting Kiowa, the language of the native Kiowa people. We began the first Kiowa dictionary at the beginning of this year and we also offer classes on the Kiowa language. When pondering how or why this is important, keep in mind that Hebrew was once a completely dead language and is now spoken by millions of people all over the world. This is what we do! 


The Impact

Though the University of Oklahoma has a Linguistics program, there is an astounding lack of resources for the department. I am traveling to the University of Sheffield in January 2012 to study topics for which the University of Oklahoma just does not have the funding. In the fall of 2012, I will stay in Sheffield and continue my studies in English or travel to France to attend the Limoges University. In either situation, I will have no place to stay during the summer months in Europe. Your donation -anything helps!- will go towards housing and food during those summer months, in addition to passports and visas, flight costs, boarding at both universities, meal costs, emergencies and phoning home! 


What I Need & What You Get

I need approximately $5,500 to live abroad for a year. This isn't much for a whole year, especially with the exchange rate, but it is a huge amount for me to earn on my own. I do not have a place to live during the summer so this is where a lot of the money will be going. Any and all funds raised will be used towards this campaign! Any excess will also be used for this campaign. All amounts help- from a dollar up.


Post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Myspace, Tumblr, webpage, or any other site you use! Send to all of your friends! Remember there are cute perks for any size donations!

story:
Our Story

Full Circles Foundation is a safe place where a strong girl can grow into an even stronger woman: a woman who has a healthy mind, body, and spirit, healthy relationships, and helps secure a healthy earth.

Full Circles Foundation gives girls the tools they need to respect themselves, their neighbors, and their home. AND, just as importantly, we equip them with the confidence to go out and USE those tools.

In our world today, there are a lot of challenges that even the strongest of girls faces - threats to her health, her economic security, her family and community, and her confidence. Full Circles Foundation allies with families to work specifically with girls who face especially big challenges.  Our girls join us in Kindergarten and we stick with them until they graduate from high school.  Over the course of 13 years, our girls will enjoy summer camps and afterschool programming; participate in apprenticeships with local, sustainable artisans and small businesses; gain community organizing skills and plan and execute their very own community campaigns; and launch and lead their own microventures. 

In June 2011, a team of 13 dedicated women and men launched the Full Circles Foundation pilot program in Raleigh, North Carolina - the Strong Camps.  The Strong Camps are a series of community-powered summer day camps for girls with high but unrealized potential.  The camps work to illuminate the connections between personal, community, and environmental health for our campers through programming in place-based environmental literacy, personal health and wellness, creative communication, civic engagement, and social entrepreneurship.  

All of this is possible through the commitment and leadership of Grand Aspirations, a Twin-Cities based venture committed to empowering, connecting, and supporting young social entrepreneurs as they create innovative, self-sustaining, and inter-dependent initiatives that integrate climate and energy solutions, economic security, and social justice.  Last fall, they adopted the Full Circles Foundation pilot as one of fifteen national "Summer of Solutions" sites.  Through Grand Aspirations, the FCF team has received fantastic training, opportunities to collaborate with energetic young people from around the country, as well as critical seed funding. 

The Impact

Full Circles Foundation works at the intersection of the environment, the economy, and gender.  We believe that the excesses and injustices seen in each of these areas are fundamentally connected and cannot be addressed in isolation of each other.  Similarly, we believe that these connections represent enormous potential - by advancing genuine economic justice, we advance genuine gender justice and environmental justice (and vice versa all the way around).  In keeping with this understanding, we have six ambitious, long-term goals:


1.  Overcoming cycles of economic vulnerability among women.

2.  Overcoming cycles of violence against women.

3.  Returning to women power over their bodies.

4.  Building civic efficacy among girls and women.

5.  Building the restorative, sustainable economy.

6.  Overcoming climate change and environmental degradation.


These goals are mutually reinforcing - building civic efficacy among girls and women helps women overcome cycles of violence against women, and working to overcome cycles of economic vulnerability among women aids in building the restorative, sustainable economy.  There is SO much evidence supporting the effectiveness of this intersectional strategy!  (Take a look at some of the organizations on which we are modeled - the Green Belt Movement, the Grameen Bank, and the Women's Environment & Development Organization).


In the short-term (this summer), we are working to increase environmental literacy, health literacy, civic efficacy, and confidence and self-esteem among our campers.

What We Need & What You Get

Lack of transportation is a major obstacle that prevents many girls from fully and consistently participating in Full Circles Foundation activities.  Our team has worked hard to provide transportation assistance this summer through Bus Buddies Program, wherein FCF instructors meet campers at bus stops near their homes and take public transportation together to and from the camp.  Bus Buddies cannot meet all of our transportation needs, however.  Some families do not live near bus stops, some of the bus routes are prohibitively long and inefficient, and there are more Bus Buddies applicants than there are instructors!  But while Bus Buddies isn't ideal, we don't necessarily like the idea of putting another gas-guzzling fleet of cars on Raleigh's already-congested roadways...


So, our solution is this:  we want to buy up a used bus and convert it to a fabulous set of bio-diesel wheels!  


While the finished product will be amazing, the process of converting the bus promises to be a wild, wonderful, and empowering experience for the Full Circles Foundation community - and it advances all of our missions!  I can't think of a better way to challenge gender norms than having a group of girls and women get elbow deep in a bus engine to convert it to run on waste vegetable oil!  Additionally, we will be able to strengthen the local economy by patronizing Piedmont Biofuels, the Triangle's bio-diesel producer from whom we will be purchasing some of our fuel!  And of course, there is the fact that bio-diesel burns cleaner than petroleum diesel.


We have budgeted $7500 for this expense:  $5000 for a used bus and $1500 for conversion expenses.  This is where we need your help.  Helping Full Circles Foundation purchase and convert a bus is a very concrete way to make a significant and lasting impact on the viability of Full Circles Foundation, the lives of the girls with whom we work, and our shared atmosphere.  And we have some special ways to say 'Thank you'... 


A $10 donation will secure you a set of three "Flower Bombs" - concentrated balls of flower power made with local compost, local clay, and wildflower seeds that one can toss onto the shoulder of the road, into vacant lots, or in your backyard.  It is a way to reclaim and revive public spaces!  Each Flower Bomb has been lovingly made and packaged by a Strong Camp participant!


A $25 donation will be thanked with an autographed copy of the Full Circles Foundation music video!  Our campers have written and composed the official Full Circles Foundation song and are working on choreographing a music video!


A $50 donation will secure you a generous helping of all-natural body, again, created from scratch by Strong Camp participants! 

A $100 donation will secure you a Full Circles !  Hooping is awesome fun and a great way to get moving.  Each hula-hoop is unique and has been handmade by a Strong Camp participant.


Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Twitter!  http://twitter.com/#!/FullCirclesNC

Become our Facebook friend!  http://www.causes.com/causes/556944

Recommend our blog to your friends!  http://www.strongcamps2011.blogspot.com/

Volunteer!  http://www.fullcirclesfoundation.org/volunteerapp.html

Contact us about replicating FCF in your Southeastern or Appalachian community!

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
RAISING MUSEUM AWARENESS AND MUSEUM CULTURE IN BERAT
Research Project Supported by the Ministry of Culture

Background

The “Onufri” Museum in the Castle of Berat is host of some of the most important cultural treasures in Albania. Yet, this museum and the city’s Ethnographic Museum attract altogether a very limited number of visitors, as both museums remain static and uninviting. The Museums need to raise awareness of their cultural values, develop pedagogical opportunities through their holdings and build audiences through the organization of thematic exhibitions, the publication of catalogues and brochures, the development of school presentations and programs. This is the very first attempt of this sort to revitalize this amazing heritage – protected by UNESCO – providing an invaluable and unique window to the past.

Since their establishment, there has virtually been no investment to make these museums attractive to the youth and stimulate the interest of past visitors to revisit them. Funds currently provided by the government are far from what is necessary to accomplish our goal. This is why your help is crucial, and even the smallest amount might make a big difference.

Our People and Mission

In this endeavor the University of New York Tirana (UNYT) is joining forces with the National Museums Center, Berat, the Regional Directorate of National Culture and the Regional Directorate of Education for the purpose of:

  • 1. Organizing a thematic exhibition with the Museum’s holdings combined with some of the Regional Directorate of National Culture’s ‘sleeping’ repository holdings.
  • 2. Developing and implementing a pedagogical cross-disciplinary pilot-module for students aged 11-14 based on the exhibits.
  • 3. Organizing a seminar training local culture and education actors on the project’s Cultural Heritage Management paradigm.

In doing so, we aim at:
  •  Increasing the number of the museums visitors.
  •  Raising awareness of the cultural treasures of the city of Berat.
  •  Generating museum interest and culture to the youth.
  •  Demonstrating a cultural heritage management paradigm to local culture and education actors to guarantee sustainability.

What We Need to Finance:
  •  The conservation of Icons.
  •  The purchase of exhibition stands, spotlights and other equipment.
  •  Training of the museum’s guides for an exhibition.
  •  Catalogue production, design and printing fees.
  •  Printing of postcards, brochures and banners.
  •  Modest compensation of teachers to run the module.

Project organization

UNYT: Project-Leading Institution
• Dr. Konstantinos Giakoumis, Project Leader
• Dr. Ariana Cela, project manager
• Undergraduate and Graduate Students

National Center of Museums in Berat
• Z. Agron Pollovina, co- leader
• Z. Arjan Prifti, expert
• Z. Ajet Nallbani, expert 

Regional Directorate of National Culture, Berat
• Z. Eugen Kallfani, co-leader
• Z. Rezarta Pilafi, expert

Regional Directorate of Education, Berat
• Z. Selman Hodaj, co-leader for educational subproject 
• Znj. Majlinda Xhamo, expert

story:
Hello, Everyone!

My name is Kimberly and due to some financial hardship and complications involving student loans, I am unable to pay for college. Currently, I am living on my own and have been financially independent since November of 2013. While I am still receiving partial support from my father to attend college, the full weight of my tuition cannot fall on him. In addition, my mother has been disabled for several years and struggles to make ends meet, leaving her no room to provide me with support. 

Receiving an education will be vital, as I aim to be a doctor and mortician, providing service for those less fortunate in providing aid and supporting the building of a stable infastructure in third world countries. I have a very long road ahead of me. This is not something that I can do without help.  

Every dollar counts and will be received with the utmost gratitude. As such, donors will receive pieces of my artwork in return. Each piece has been created judiciously and skillfully and will be sent directly from me to you. 

I thank everyone who wishes to participate.

story:
My name is Shilla Adyero.  I am from Gulu, Uganda, and a master’s candidate in Sustainable Development at SIT Graduate Institute in Brattleboro, Vermont in the United States.  I am also the founder and executive director of a nonprofit organization called Lutino Adunu, which means “Children Loved” in my native language of Acholi.  I founded this organization to provide a safe place for children at a local community library.  The mission of Lutino Adunu is to promote learning and support through community library, sponsorship and the establishment of a school for rebuilding the lives of the children  in the post war northern Uganda.

  I came to SIT Graduate Institute with the goal of furthering my education so I can return to Uganda and continue to advocate for children’s rights and their education.  I raised $35,000 dollars towards my tuition at SIT and am now seeking additional funding of $4,500 to continue my studies this spring.  I have already gained skills and knowledge here that will be invaluable to my future work, and I want to continue to learn from my professors and classmates this spring.   

Would you please consider making a monetary donation to help me achieve this goal, not only for myself but for the future of children in Uganda?  All money raised will go towards paying for me to attend SIT Graduate Institute next semester.   Thank you for your consideration in helping me further my work! 


Here is a link to the website for my organization Lutino Adunu: http://www.lutino.org
